Detailed Description

VerilogWriter Class.

VerilogWriter - Prints the Verilog for a RTLModule. Also handles printing memory controller, test suite, and avalon interface

Definition at line 33 of file VerilogWriter.h.

int legup::VerilogWriter::getAvalonBusWidth ( const Function *  F)
private

Definition at line 4958 of file VerilogWriter.cpp.

4958  {
4959 
4960  int NumArg32bit = 0;
4961  int NumArg64bit = 0;
4962  for (Function::const_arg_iterator it = F->arg_begin(), e = F->arg_end();
4963  it != e; ++it) { // get number of 32 bit and 64 bit arguments
4964  if (const IntegerType *ITy = dyn_cast<IntegerType>(it->getType())) {
4965  if (ITy->getBitWidth() == 64) {
4966  NumArg64bit++;
4967  } else if (ITy->getBitWidth() <= 32) {
4968  NumArg32bit++;
4969  }
4970  } else if (it->getType()->isFloatTy()) { // if argument is a float
4971  NumArg32bit++;
4972  } else if (it->getType()->isDoubleTy()) { // if argument is a double
4973  NumArg64bit++;
4974  } else if (dyn_cast<PointerType>(
4975  it->getType())) { // if argument is a pointer
4976  NumArg32bit++;
4977  } else if (dyn_cast<ArrayType>(
4978  it->getType())) { // if argument is an array
4979  NumArg32bit++;
4980  } else {
4981  assert(0 && "Unsupported Argument for Accelerator\n");
4982  }
4983  }
4984  return (ceil(log(NumArg32bit + 2 * NumArg64bit + 3) /
4985  log(2))); // define avalon slave address bus width according to
4986  // number of arguments
4987 }

std::vector< bool > legup::VerilogWriter::parseDisplayString ( const std::string &  display_string)
private

Definition at line 7296 of file VerilogWriter.cpp.

7296  {
7297  std::vector<bool> is_unsigned_vec;
7298  for (size_t pos = display_string.find('%');
7299  pos < display_string.length() && pos != string::npos;
7300  pos = display_string.find('%', pos + 2 /* skip the char after % */)) {
7301  assert(display_string.at(pos) == '%');
7302  // '%' sign cannot be the last char in the string, except "%%" case.
7303  assert(pos < display_string.length() - 1);
7304  // Ignore "%%" since it's escaped percentage sign.
7305  if (display_string.at(pos + 1) == '%')
7306  continue;
7307  // Check if the placeholder is '%u'
7308  is_unsigned_vec.push_back(display_string.at(pos + 1) == 'u');
7309  }
7310  return is_unsigned_vec;
7311 }
assert
assert(Globals.size() > 1)
void legup::VerilogWriter::parseMIPSdisassembly ( )
private

Definition at line 4768 of file VerilogWriter.cpp.

4768  {
4769 
4770  // get the file name
4771  const char *dis = NULL;
4772  std::string Disassembly;
4773  Disassembly = std::getenv("LEGUP_ACCELERATOR_FILENAME");
4774  Disassembly += ".src";
4775  dis = Disassembly.c_str();
4776  std::string var_name, var_addr;
4777 
4778  // TODO: LLVM 3.5 update: this:
4779  /*
4780  OwningPtr<MemoryBuffer> MB;
4781  error_code ec;
4782  // open file
4783  if(!(ec = MemoryBuffer::getFile(dis, MB))) {
4784 
4785  // store file content in a buffer
4786  MemoryBuffer *F = MB.take();
4787  StringRef Buffer = F->getBuffer();
4788  */
4789 
4790  // TODO: LLVM 3.5 update: gets replaced by this:
4791  auto MB = MemoryBuffer::getFile(dis);
4792  if (MB) {
4793 
4794  StringRef Buffer = MB.get()->getBuffer();
4795  // TODO: end LLVM 3.5 update
4796 
4797  // iterate through all RAMs
4798  for (Allocation::const_ram_iterator i = alloc->ram_begin(),
4799  e = alloc->ram_end();
4800  i != e; ++i) {
4801  RAM *R = *i;
4802  const Value *V = R->getValue();
4803  // if it's global variable
4804  if (const GlobalVariable *G = dyn_cast<GlobalVariable>(V)) {
4805 
4806  // don't need to store constants
4807  if (G->isConstant())
4808  continue;
4809 
4810  // get the name of the variable
4811  // this is the actual name used in LLVM IR (to be used for
4812  // parsing in MIPS assembly)
4813  // separate names need to be used for parsing vs printing
4814  // verilog
4815  // since some llvm variables may have name.number format where
4816  // as in verilog it doesn't allow having . (dot)
4817  // in LegUp, . is replaced with _ (underscore)
4818  var_name = V->getName();
4819  var_name.insert(
4820  0, "<"); // making into the format in MIPS disassembly
4821  var_name.append(">:");
4822 
4823  // search buffer for the variable
4824  size_t index = Buffer.find(var_name);
4825  if (index == StringRef::npos) {
4826  errs() << "\nError: Address for global variable "
4827  << var_name << " not found in disassembly!\n\n";
4828  assert(0);
4829  }
4830 
4831  // index holds the starting position of the variable string
4832  // now we need to get the address which is written before the
4833  // variable name
4834 
4835  // go back in buffer until no more white space is found
4836  // this position is the position of the last number of the
4837  // address we are looking for
4838  while (Buffer[index] == ' ') {
4839  index--;
4840  }
4841  size_t lastPos = index;
4842  // now go back in buffer until new line is found
4843  // this position is the position of the first number of the
4844  // address we are looking for
4845  while (Buffer[index] != '\n') {
4846  index--;
4847  }
4848  size_t firstPos = index;
4849 
4850  var_addr = Buffer.substr(firstPos + 1, lastPos - firstPos - 1);
4851 
4852  // store the variable and its address is a map
4853  // the key here is the verilog name that will be printing
4854  globalAddresses[R->getName()] = var_addr;
4855  }
4856  }
4857  } else {
4858  assert(0 && "Disassembly file not found!\n");
4859  }
4860 }

70  // steering logic and instantiations for locks/barriers

76  e = alloc->rtl_end();

84  RTLModule *dbgTraceScheduler =
85  alloc->getDbgInfo()->getTraceSchedulerRtl();
86  printRTL(dbgTraceScheduler);
87  }
88

6298  {
6299 
6300  int argumentNumber = 1;
6301 
6302  RTLModule *mod = alloc->getModuleForFunction(F);
6303  Out << mod->getBody() << "\n";
6304  std::string moduleName = mod->getName();
6305  stripInvalidCharacters(moduleName);
6306  Out << moduleName << " " << moduleName << "_inst ("
6307  << "\n";
6308 
6309  // CAUTION: This loop does not increment itself. Any "continue"s
6310  // must increment i.
6311  for (RTLModule::const_signal_iterator i = mod->port_begin(),
6312  e = mod->port_end();
6313  i != e;) {
6314 
6315  const RTLSignal *s = *i;
6316  std::string name = s->getName();
6317 
6318  // Some of the signals at this level do not have actual connections in
6319  // the RTL. We must check to see if the signal has a driver and then
6320  // provide some special handling if it doesn't.
6321  //
6322  std::string driverName =
6323  s->getNumDrivers() ? s->getDriver(0)->getName() : s->getName();
6324 
6325  bool signalIsArgument =
6326  driverName.find("arg_") == 0 &&
6327  name.find("memory_controller") == std::string::npos;
6328  if (signalIsArgument) {
6329  driverName = "ARG" + IntToString(argumentNumber);
6330  ++argumentNumber;
6331  }
6332 
6333  if (name == "return_val" && !voidtype)
6334  driverName = "return_val_wire";
6335  else if (name == "finish")
6336  driverName = "finish";
6337  else if (name == "clk2x")
6338  driverName = "1'b0";
6339  else if (name == "clk1x_follower")
6340  driverName = "1'b0";
6341 
6342  // memory_controller_waitrequest is the proper name, so we don't want to
6343  // change it. If the signal is any other memory_controller signal
6344  // we want to modify its name to match the special convention for the
6345  // hybrid flow.
6346  //
6347  // NOTE for future refactorers: you can check if a signal is a memory
6348  // signal with the propagating signals data structure in Allocation.cpp
6349  //
6350  // The following code was left as a string test to remind all users of
6351  // how fragile the code that follows is. The string test should be
6352  // changed when there is a safer way to connect the memory signals in
6353  // the hybrid flow.
6354  //
6355  // - Mathew hall
6356  //
6357  else if ((name.find("memory_controller_waitrequest") ==
6358  std::string::npos) &&
6359  (name.find("memory_controller") != std::string::npos)) {
6360 
6361  // Unfortunately, we must convert the standard memory signal names
6362  // to a custom scheme for the hybrid flow.
6363  //
6364 
6365  char lastCharacter = *name.rbegin();
6366  if (!(LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("DUAL_PORT_BINDING")) &&
6367  lastCharacter == 'b') {
6368  ++i;
6369  continue;
6370  }
6371 
6372  // This code is fragile. If the following assertion led you here
6373  // then somebody probably changed the suffix style for memory
6374  // signals.
6375  //
6376  assert(lastCharacter == 'a' || lastCharacter == 'b');
6377 
6378  if (name.find("_write_enable_") != std::string::npos)
6379  driverName = "write_enable";
6380  else if (name.find("_enable_") != std::string::npos)
6381  driverName = "enable";
6382  else if (name.find("_address_") != std::string::npos)
6383  driverName = "memory_address";
6384  else if (name.find("_size_") != std::string::npos)
6385  driverName = "memory_controller_size";
6386  else if (name.find("_in_") != std::string::npos)
6387  driverName = "data_to_memory";
6388  else if (name.find("_out_") != std::string::npos)
6389  driverName = "data_from_memory";
6390  else
6391  assert(0); // Is there some new memory signal?
6392 
6393  driverName += (lastCharacter == 'a') ? "_a" : "_b";
6394  }
6395 
6396  if (!driverName.empty()) {
6397  Out << "\t";
6398  Out << "." << name << "(" << driverName << ")"
6399  << ((++i == e) ? "\n);" : ",\n");
6400  } else {
6401  ++i;
6402  }
6403  }
6404 }

3913  {
3914 
3915  // if( prevSize==0 ) prevSize_and = 3'b000
3916  // if( prevSize==1 ) prevSize_and = 3'b001
3917  // if( prevSize==2 ) prevSize_and = 3'b011
3918  // if( prevSize==3 ) prevSize_and = 3'b111
3919  // prevSize AND with last 3 bits of prevAddr to check the aligment
3920  Out << indent0 << "prevSize" << postfix << "_and[0] = prevSize" << postfix
3921  << "[1] | prevSize" << postfix << "[0];\n" << indent0 << "prevSize"
3922  << postfix << "_and[1] = prevSize" << postfix << "[1];\n" << indent0

2419  RTLModule *m = new RTLModule(type + "_dual_port");
2420 
2421  // initial all the params to specify size of the altsynrams to 0 in the ram
2422  m->addParam("width_a", "0");
2423  m->addParam("width_b", "0");
2424  m->addParam("widthad_a", "0");
2425  m->addParam("widthad_b", "0");
2426  m->addParam("numwords_a", "0");
2427  m->addParam("numwords_b", "0");
2428  m->addParam("latency", "1");
2429  m->addParam("init_file", "\"UNUSED\"");
2430 
2431  RTLSignal *clk = m->addIn("clk");
2432  RTLSignal *clken = m->addIn("clken");
2433 
2434  RTLSignal *addr_a = m->addIn("address_a", RTLWidth("(widthad_a-1)"));
2435  RTLSignal *addr_b = m->addIn("address_b", RTLWidth("(widthad_b-1)"));
2436  // these outputs are connected in getMemoryOutputRegisters()
2437  m->addOut("q_a", RTLWidth("(width_a-1)"));
2438  m->addOut("q_b", RTLWidth("(width_b-1)"));
2439  RTLSignal *q_a_wire = m->addWire("q_a_wire", RTLWidth("(width_a-1)"));
2440  RTLSignal *q_b_wire = m->addWire("q_b_wire", RTLWidth("(width_b-1)"));
2441 
2442  // Altera specific RAM
2443  RTLModule *a = m->addModule("altsyncram", "altsyncram_component");
2444 
2445  RTLConst *one = m->addConst("1");
2446  RTLConst *zero = m->addConst("0");
2447  RTLConst *blank = m->addConst("");
2448 
2449  // need this to avoid:
2450  // # ** Warning: (vsim-3016) div_const.v(111): Port type is incompatible
2451  // with connection (port 'clk').
2452  RTLSignal *clk_wire = m->addWire("clk_wire");
2453  clk_wire->connect(clk);
2454 
2455  // specify the inputs and outputs for the altsynram module
2456  a->addIn("clock0")->connect(clk_wire);
2457  a->addIn("clock1")->connect(one);
2458  a->addIn("clocken0")->connect(clken);
2459  a->addIn("clocken1")->connect(one);
2460  a->addIn("clocken2")->connect(one);
2461  a->addIn("clocken3")->connect(one);
2462  a->addIn("aclr0")->connect(zero);
2463  a->addIn("aclr1")->connect(zero);
2464  a->addIn("addressstall_a")->connect(zero);
2465  a->addIn("addressstall_b")->connect(zero);
2466  a->addOut("eccstatus")->connect(blank);
2467  a->addIn("address_a")->connect(addr_a);
2468  a->addIn("address_b")->connect(addr_b);
2469  a->addIn("rden_a")->connect(clken);
2470  a->addIn("rden_b")->connect(clken);
2471  a->addOut("q_a")->connect(q_a_wire);
2472  a->addOut("q_b")->connect(q_b_wire);
2473  RTLSignal *byteena_a = a->addIn("byteena_a");
2474  RTLSignal *byteena_b = a->addIn("byteena_b");
2475 
2476  if (readonly) {
2477  a->addIn("wren_a")->connect(zero);
2478  a->addIn("wren_b")->connect(zero);
2479  a->addIn("data_a")->connect(blank);
2480  a->addIn("data_b")->connect(blank);
2481  byteena_a->connect(blank);
2482  byteena_b->connect(blank);
2483  } else {
2484  RTLSignal *we_a = m->addIn("wren_a");
2485  RTLSignal *we_b = m->addIn("wren_b");
2486  RTLSignal *data_a = m->addIn("data_a", RTLWidth("(width_a-1)"));
2487  RTLSignal *data_b = m->addIn("data_b", RTLWidth("(width_b-1)"));
2488  a->addIn("wren_a")->connect(we_a);
2489  a->addIn("wren_b")->connect(we_b);
2490  a->addIn("data_a")->connect(data_a);
2491  a->addIn("data_b")->connect(data_b);
2492  if (alloc->usesGenericRAMs()) {
2493  m->addParam("width_be_a", "0");
2494  m->addParam("width_be_b", "0");
2495  RTLSignal *byteena_m_a =
2496  m->addIn("byteena_a", RTLWidth("width_be_a-1"));
2497  RTLSignal *byteena_m_b =
2498  m->addIn("byteena_b", RTLWidth("width_be_b-1"));
2499  byteena_a->connect(byteena_m_a);
2500  byteena_b->connect(byteena_m_b);
2501  a->addParam("width_byteena_a", "width_be_a");
2502  a->addParam("width_byteena_b", "width_be_b");
2503  } else {
2504  // if we don't use generic RAMs, byteenab will always be 1
2505  byteena_a->connect(one);
2506  byteena_b->connect(one);
2507  a->addParam("width_byteena_a", "1");
2508  a->addParam("width_byteena_b", "1");
2509  }
2510  }
2511 
2512  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("DUAL_PORT_BINDING")) {
2513  a->addParam("operation_mode", "\"BIDIR_DUAL_PORT\"");
2514  } else {
2515  a->addParam("operation_mode", "\"SINGLE_PORT\"");
2516  }
2517 
2518  // can be OLD_DATA , DONT_CARE or NEW_DATA_NO_NBE_READ
2519  a->addParam("read_during_write_mode_mixed_ports", "\"OLD_DATA\"");
2520  a->addParam("init_file", "init_file");
2521  a->addParam("lpm_hint", "\"ENABLE_RUNTIME_MOD=NO\"");
2522  a->addParam("lpm_type", "\"altsyncram\"");
2523  a->addParam("power_up_uninitialized", "\"FALSE\"");
2524 
2525  // the space actually matters for simulation
2526  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getDeviceFamily() == "CycloneII") {
2527  a->addParam("intended_device_family", "\"Cyclone II\"");
2528  } else if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getDeviceFamily() == "StratixIV") {
2529  a->addParam("intended_device_family", "\"Stratix IV\"");
2530  } else if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getDeviceFamily() == "CycloneIV") {
2531  a->addParam("intended_device_family", "\"Cyclone IV\"");
2532  } else if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getDeviceFamily() == "CycloneV") {
2533  a->addParam("intended_device_family", "\"Cyclone V\"");
2534  } else if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getDeviceFamily() == "StratixV") {
2535  a->addParam("intended_device_family", "\"Stratix V\"");
2536  } else {
2537  llvm_unreachable("Unrecognized device family!");
2538  }
2539  a->addParam("clock_enable_input_a", "\"BYPASS\"");
2540  a->addParam("clock_enable_input_b", "\"BYPASS\"");
2541  a->addParam("clock_enable_output_a", "\"BYPASS\"");
2542  a->addParam("clock_enable_output_b", "\"BYPASS\"");
2543  a->addParam("outdata_aclr_a", "\"NONE\"");
2544  a->addParam("outdata_aclr_b", "\"NONE\"");
2545  a->addParam("outdata_reg_a", "\"UNREGISTERED\"");
2546  a->addParam("outdata_reg_b", "\"UNREGISTERED\"");
2547  a->addParam("numwords_a", "numwords_a");
2548  a->addParam("numwords_b", "numwords_b");
2549  a->addParam("widthad_a", "widthad_a");
2550  a->addParam("widthad_b", "widthad_b");
2551  a->addParam("width_a", "width_a");
2552  a->addParam("width_b", "width_b");
2553  a->addParam("address_reg_b", "\"CLOCK0\"");
2554  a->addParam("byteena_reg_b", "\"CLOCK0\"");
2555  a->addParam("indata_reg_b", "\"CLOCK0\"");
2556  a->addParam("wrcontrol_wraddress_reg_b", "\"CLOCK0\"");
2557 
2558  // doesn't work on StratixII:
2559  //" altsyncram_component.read_during_write_mode_port_a = "DONT_CARE","
2560 
2561  std::string latencyRegisters = getMemoryOutputRegisters();
2562  m->setBody(latencyRegisters);
2563 
2564  printRTL(m);
2565  delete m;
2566 }

1211  "input clk;\n" <<
1212  "input [N-1:0] req_in;\n" <<
1213  "input waitrequest;\n" <<
1214  "output [N-1:0] grant_comb;\n" <<
1215  "\n" <<
1216  "wire [N-1:0] req;\n" <<
1217  "reg [N-1:0] rotate_ptr;\n" <<
1218  "wire [N-1:0] mask_req;\n" <<
1219  "wire [N-1:0] mask_grant;\n" <<
1220  "wire [N-1:0] grant_comb;\n" <<
1221  "reg [N-1:0] grant_reg;\n" <<
1222  "reg [N-1:0] grant;\n" <<
1223  "wire no_mask_req;\n" <<
1224  "wire [N-1:0] nomask_grant;\n" <<
1225  "wire update_ptr;\n" <<
1226  "reg waitrequest_reg;\n" <<
1227  "genvar i;\n" <<
1228  "\n" <<
1229 
1230  "always @(posedge clk)\n" <<
1231  "begin\n" <<
1232  "\twaitrequest_reg <= waitrequest;\n" <<
1233  "\tif (waitrequest)\n" <<
1234  "\tbegin\n" <<
1235  "\t\tgrant_reg <= grant_comb;\n" <<
1236  "\tend\n" <<
1237  "end\n\n" <<
1238 
1239  "assign req[N-1:0] = req_in[N-1:0];\n" <<
1240  "// rotate pointer update logic\n" <<
1241  "assign update_ptr = |grant_comb[N-1:0];\n" <<
1242  "always @ (posedge clk)\n" <<
1243  "begin\n" <<
1244  " if (rst_an) begin\n" <<
1245  " rotate_ptr[0] <= 1'b1;\n" <<
1246  " rotate_ptr[1] <= 1'b1;\n" <<
1247  " end\n" <<
1248  " else if (update_ptr && !waitrequest)\n" <<
1249  " begin\n" <<
1250  " // note: N must be at least 2\n" <<
1251  " rotate_ptr[0] <= grant_comb[N-1];\n" <<
1252  " rotate_ptr[1] <= grant_comb[N-1] | grant_comb[0];\n" <<
1253  " end\n" <<
1254  "end\n" <<
1255  "\n" <<
1256  "generate\n" <<
1257  " for (i=2;i<N;i=i+1) begin : rotateptr\n" <<
1258  " always @ (posedge clk or negedge rst_an)\n" <<
1259  " begin\n" <<
1260  " if (!rst_an)\n" <<
1261  " rotate_ptr[i] <= 1'b1;\n" <<
1262  " else if (update_ptr && !waitrequest)\n" <<
1263  " rotate_ptr[i] <= grant[N-1] | (|grant[i-1:0]);\n" <<
1264  " end\n" <<
1265  " end\n" <<
1266  "endgenerate\n" <<
1267  "\n" <<
1268  "// mask grant generation logic\n" <<
1269  "assign mask_req[N-1:0] = req[N-1:0] & rotate_ptr[N-1:0];\n" <<
1270  "\n" <<
1271  "assign mask_grant[0] = mask_req[0];\n" <<
1272  "generate \n" <<
1273  " for (i=1;i<N;i=i+1) begin : maskgrant\n" <<
1274  " assign mask_grant[i] = (~|mask_req[i-1:0]) & mask_req[i];\n" <<
1275  " end\n" <<
1276  "endgenerate\n" <<
1277  "\n" <<
1278  "// non-mask grant generation logic\n" <<
1279  "assign nomask_grant[0] = req[0];\n" <<
1280  "generate\n" <<
1281  " for (i=1;i<N;i=i+1) begin : nomaskgrant\n" <<
1282  " assign nomask_grant[i] = (~|req[i-1:0]) & req[i];\n" <<
1283  " end\n" <<
1284  "endgenerate\n" <<
1285  "\n" <<
1286  "// grant generation logic\n" <<
1287  "assign no_mask_req = ~|mask_req[N-1:0];\n" <<
1288  "assign grant_comb[N-1:0] = waitrequest_reg? grant_reg[N-1:0] :
1289  (mask_grant[N-1:0] | (nomask_grant[N-1:0] & {N{no_mask_req}}));\n" <<
1290  //"assign grant_comb[N-1:0] = mask_grant[N-1:0] | (nomask_grant[N-1:0] &
1291  {N{no_mask_req}});\n" <<
1292  "\n" <<
1293  "always @ (posedge clk or negedge rst_an)\n" <<
1294  "begin\n" <<
1295  " if (!rst_an) grant[N-1:0] <= {N{1'b0}};\n" <<
1296  " else grant[N-1:0] <= grant_comb[N-1:0];\n" <<
1297  "end\n" <<
1298  "endmodule\n\n";*/
1299 
1300  /*

5483 
5484  int argIdx = 1;
5485  int addrIdx = 3;

5487  for (int i = 0; i < NumParams; i++) {
5488  data_size = arg_bitwidth[i];
5489  if (data_size == 31) {
5490  Out << "\nalways @(posedge clk)\n"
5491  << "begin\n"
5492  << "\tif (start || reset)\n"
5493  << "\tbegin\n"
5494  << "\t\tARG" << argIdx << "_ready <= 1'b0;\n"

Definition at line 5072 of file VerilogWriter.cpp.

5073  {
5074 
5075  int NumParams = F->arg_size();
5076  int argIdx = 1;
5077  int data_size;
5078  if (NumParams > 0) {
5079 
5080  for (Function::const_arg_iterator it = F->arg_begin(), e = F->arg_end();
5081  it != e; ++it) {
5082  data_size = 31;
5083  if (const IntegerType *ITy = dyn_cast<IntegerType>(it->getType())) {
5084  if (ITy->getBitWidth() == 64) // if data type is long long
5085  data_size = 63;
5086  } else if (it->getType()->isDoubleTy()) {
5087  data_size = 63;
5088  }
5089  arg_bitwidth.push_back(data_size);
5090  Out << "reg [" << data_size << ":0]ARG" << argIdx << ";\n";
5091  Out << "reg ARG" << argIdx << "_ready;\n";
5092  argIdx++;
5093  }
5094  Out << "wire parameter_ready;\n\n";
5095  }

void legup::VerilogWriter::printBarrierModule ( )
private

Definition at line 723 of file VerilogWriter.cpp.

723  {
724  Out << "`timescale 1ns / 1ns\n"
725  << "module legup_HW_barrier (\n"
726  << " clk,\n"
727  << " reset,\n"
728  << " address,\n"
729  << " read,\n"
730  << " write,\n"
731  << " readdata,\n"
732  << " writedata\n"
733  << ");\n\n"
734  <<
735 
736  "input clk;\n"
737  << "input reset;\n"
738  << "input address;\n"
739  << "input read;\n"
740  << "input write;\n"
741  << "output [`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_DATA_SIZE-1:0] readdata;\n"
742  << "input [`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_DATA_SIZE-1:0] writedata;\n\n"
743  <<
744 
745  "reg [`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_DATA_SIZE-1:0] barrier_count;\n"
746  << "reg [`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_DATA_SIZE-1:0] numthreads;\n"
747  << "wire [`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_DATA_SIZE-1:0] writedata;\n\n"
748  <<
749 
750  "always @(posedge clk)\n"
751  << "begin\n"
752  << " if (reset)\n"
753  << " begin\n"
754  << " numthreads <= 0;\n"
755  << " end\n"
756  << " //barrier initialization to store the number of threads\n"
757  << " else if (write && !address)\n"
758  << " begin\n"
759  << " numthreads <= writedata;\n"
760  << " end\n"
761  << "end\n\n"
762  <<
763 
764  "always @(posedge clk)\n"
765  << "begin\n"
766  << " if (reset)\n"
767  << " begin\n"
768  << " barrier_count <= 0;\n"
769  << " end\n"
770  << " //whenever each thread reaches the barrier, it writes to the "
771  "barrier, which increments the counter\n"
772  << " else if (write && address)\n"
773  << " begin\n"
774  << " barrier_count <= barrier_count + 1;\n"
775  << " end\n"
776  << " //if the counter reaches the total number of threads, it "
777  "resets to zero\n"
778  << " //this is needed for when the same barrier is used multiplie "
779  "times without initializing the barrier again\n"
780  << " else if (barrier_count == numthreads)\n"
781  << " begin\n"
782  << " barrier_count <= 0;\n"
783  << " end\n"
784  << "end\n\n"
785  <<
786 
787  "//if the barrier count is zero, that means all threads have reached "
788  "the barrier\n"
789  << "assign readdata = barrier_count;\n\n"
790  <<
791 
792  "endmodule\n\n";
793 }

1714  << "\t\t\thex2 <= " << DEBUG_SIGNAL_NAME_CURRENT_STATE << "[3:0];\n"
1715  << "\t\t\thex1 <= hlsd_state[7:4];\n"
1716  << "\t\t\thex0 <= hlsd_state[3:0];\n"
1717  << "\t\tend\n"
1718  << "\tend\n";
1719  } else {
1720  Out << "\n\talways @ (*) begin\n"
1721  << "\t\thex7 <= return_val_reg[31:28];\n"
1722  << "\t\thex6 <= return_val_reg[27:24];\n"
1723  << "\t\thex5 <= return_val_reg[23:20];\n"
1724  << "\t\thex4 <= return_val_reg[19:16];\n"
1725  << "\t\thex3 <= return_val_reg[15:12];\n"
1726  << "\t\thex2 <= return_val_reg[11:8];\n"
1727  << "\t\thex1 <= return_val_reg[7:4];\n"
1728  << "\t\thex0 <= return_val_reg[3:0];\n"
1729  << "\tend\n"
1730  << "assign UART_TXD = 1'b0;\n";
1731  }
1732 
1733  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("MULTIPUMPING")) {
1734  Out << "\n clock_follower clock_follower_inst (\n"
1735  << " .reset ( reset ),\n"
1736  << " .clk1x ( clk ),\n"
1737  << " .clk2x ( clk2x ),\n"
1738  << " .clk1x_follower ( clk1x_follower )\n"
1739  << " );";
1740  }
1741 
1742  if (alloc->getDbgInfo()->isDebugRtlEnabled()) {
1743  // Debugger doesn't need a state machine start/stop circuit.
1744  Out << "\n\talways @(posedge clk) begin\n"
1745  << "\t\tif (reset)\n"
1746  << "\t\t\treturn_val_reg <= 0;\n"
1747  << "\t\telse if (finish) begin\n"
1748  << "\t\t\treturn_val_reg <= return_val;\n"
1749  << "\t\tend\n"
1750  << "\tend\n";
1751  } else {
1752  Out << "\n parameter s_WAIT = 3'b001, s_START = 3'b010, s_EXE = "
1753  "3'b011,\n"
1754  << " s_DONE = 3'b100;\n"
1755  << "\n"
1756  << " // state registers\n"
1757  << " reg [3:0] y_Q, Y_D;\n"
1758  << "\n"
1759  << " assign LEDG[3:0] = y_Q;\n"
1760  << "\n"
1761  << " // next state\n"
1762  << " always @(*)\n"
1763  << " begin\n"
1764  << " case (y_Q)\n"
1765  << " s_WAIT: if (go) Y_D = s_START; else Y_D = y_Q;\n"
1766  << "\n"
1767  << " s_START: Y_D = s_EXE;\n"
1768  << "\n"
1769  << " s_EXE: if (!finish) Y_D = s_EXE; else Y_D = "
1770  "s_DONE;\n"
1771  << "\n"
1772  << " s_DONE: Y_D = s_DONE;\n"
1773  << "\n"
1774  << " default: Y_D = 3'bxxx;\n"
1775  << " endcase\n"
1776  << " end\n"
1777  << "\n"
1778  << " // current state\n"
1779  << " always @(posedge clk)\n"
1780  << " begin\n"
1781  << " if (reset) // synchronous clear\n"
1782  << " y_Q <= s_WAIT;\n"
1783  << " else\n"
1784  << " y_Q <= Y_D;\n"
1785  << " end\n"
1786  << "\n"
1787  << " always @(posedge clk)\n"
1788  << " if (y_Q == s_EXE && finish)\n"
1789  << " return_val_reg <= return_val;\n"
1790  << " else if (y_Q == s_DONE)\n"
1791  << " return_val_reg <= return_val_reg;\n"
1792  << " else\n"
1793  << " return_val_reg <= 0;\n"
1794  << "\n"
1795  << "\n"
1796  << " assign start = (y_Q == s_START);";
1797  }
1798 }

void legup::VerilogWriter::printCaseFSM ( const RTLSignal *  signal,
std::string  assignOp 
)
private

Definition at line 6739 of file VerilogWriter.cpp.

6740  {
6741 
6742  std::map<std::string, std::vector<int>>
6743  FSMCases; // build up an association between state names and conditions
6744 
6745  unsigned numConditions = signal->getNumConditions();
6746  unsigned sigWidth = signal->getWidth().numBits(rtl, alloc);
6747  assert(numConditions > 0);
6748 
6749  for (unsigned i = 0; i < numConditions; ++i) {
6750  const RTLSignal *driver = signal->getDriver(i);
6751  const RTLSignal *condition = signal->getCondition(i);
6752  assert(driver);
6753 
6754  std::string param;
6755  getStateName(condition, param);
6756  FSMCases[param].push_back(i);
6757  }
6758 
6759  // first we print out the always block for the sequential logic
6760  Out << "if (reset == 1'b1)\n";
6761  Out << "\tcur_state <= LEGUP_0;\n"; // janders DANGER: this relies on the
6762  // first state of the FSM having a
6763  // specific name LEGUP_0
6764  if (alloc->getPropagatingSignals()->functionUsesMemory(rtl->getName())) {
6765  Out << "else if (memory_controller_waitrequest == 1'd1)\n";
6766  Out << "\tcur_state <= cur_state;\n";
6767  }
6768  Out << "else\n";
6769  Out << "\tcur_state <= next_state;\n";
6770  Out << "end\n\n";
6771 
6772  Out << "always @(*)\n"; // now this is the always block for the "next state"
6773  // logic -- completely combinational
6774  Out << "begin\n";
6775  Out << "next_state = cur_state;\n"; // needed to avoid "inferred latches" in
6776  // synthesis
6777  if (!LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("CASEX"))
6778  Out << "case(";
6779  else
6780  Out << "casex(";
6781  printValue(signal);
6782  Out << ") // synthesis parallel_case \n"; // janders -- use the ALTR
6783  // pragma
6784 
6785  for (std::map<std::string, std::vector<int>>::iterator i = FSMCases.begin();
6786  i != FSMCases.end(); ++i) {
6787 
6788  if (i->first == "")
6789  continue;
6790 
6791  if (!LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("CASEX"))
6792  Out << i->first << ":"
6793  << "\n";
6794  else
6795  Out << i->first << "_X"
6796  << ":"
6797  << "\n";
6798 
6799  int count = 0;
6800 
6801  if (i->second.size() == 2) {
6802  // unconditional transition in the state diagram
6803  // how do we know this? because any state has "at a minimum" 2
6804  // conditions:
6805  // one when the "wait" signal is asserted (1) and one when the
6806  // "wait" signal is 0.
6807  // we handled the case for the "wait" signal being 1 in the
6808  // sequential always block above.
6809  for (std::vector<int>::iterator i2 = i->second.begin();
6810  i2 != i->second.end(); ++i2) {
6811  if ((signal->getDriver(*i2)->getName() == i->first) && !count) {
6812  count++;
6813  // janders -- the reason we are checking !count here is that
6814  // some circuits actually have states where they get "stuck"
6815  // (infinite loop in HW).
6816  // e.g. dhrystone has a state where, when we enter it, we
6817  // continue
6818  // to spin on that state, even if the wait request for the
6819  // memory controller
6820  // is logic-0
6821  continue;
6822  } else {
6823  Out << "\t\tnext_state = ";
6824  printValue(signal->getDriver(*i2), sigWidth);
6825  Out << ";\n";
6826  break;
6827  }
6828  }
6829  } else {
6830  for (std::vector<int>::iterator i2 = i->second.begin();
6831  i2 != i->second.end(); ++i2) {
6832 
6833  if (signal->getDriver(*i2)->getName() == i->first)
6834  continue; // handled in the sequential always block above
6835 
6836  std::vector<const RTLSignal *> clauses;
6837  const RTLSignal *condition = signal->getCondition(*i2);
6838  caseConditions(condition, clauses); // extracts the conditions
6839  // we care about (ignoring
6840  // ones that are handled in
6841  // the sequential always
6842  // block above)
6843 
6844  if (!count)
6845  Out << "\tif (";
6846  else
6847  Out << "\telse if (";
6848 
6849  for (std::vector<const RTLSignal *>::iterator i3 =
6850  clauses.begin();
6851  i3 != clauses.end();) {
6852  printValue(*i3);
6853  ++i3;
6854  if (i3 != clauses.end())
6855  Out << " && ";
6856  }
6857 
6858  Out << ")\n";
6859  Out << "\t\tnext_state = ";
6860  printValue(signal->getDriver(*i2), sigWidth);
6861  Out << ";\n";
6862  count++;
6863  }
6864  }
6865  }
6866  Out << "default:\n\tnext_state = cur_state;\n";
6867  Out << "endcase\n\n";
6868 }
i2
***NAME is the name of the raw_ostream unsigned unsigned & i2

513  {
514  Out << "// see XAPP706\n"
515  << "// the clock follower avoids hold-time violations by generating a "
516  "signal\n"
517  << "// from a register clocked by clk2x that follows clk1x\n"
518  << "module clock_follower (reset, clk1x, clk2x, clk1x_follower);\n"
519  << "input clk1x, clk2x, reset;\n"
520  << "output reg clk1x_follower;\n"
521  << "reg toggle, tog_1;\n"
522  << "\n"
523  << "always @(posedge clk1x or posedge reset)\n"
524  << "if (reset)\n"
525  << "toggle <= 0;\n"
526  << "else\n"
527  << "toggle <= ~toggle;\n"
528  << "\n"
529  << "always @(posedge clk2x)\n"
530  << "tog_1 <= toggle;\n"
531  << "\n"
532  << "always @(posedge clk2x)\n"
533  << "clk1x_follower <= ~(toggle ^ tog_1);\n"
534  << "\n"
535  << "endmodule\n";

2135  << "\t\telse if (finish) begin\n"
2136  << "\t\t\treturn_val_reg <= return_val;\n"
2137  << "\t\tend\n"
2138  << "\tend\n";
2139  } else {
2140  Out <<
2141  " parameter s_WAIT = 3'b001, s_START = 3'b010, s_EXE = 3'b011,\n" <<
2142  " s_DONE = 3'b100;\n" <<
2143  "\n" <<
2144  " // state registers\n" <<
2145  " reg [3:0] y_Q, Y_D;\n" <<
2146  "\n" <<
2147  " assign LEDG[3:0] = y_Q;\n" <<
2148  "\n" <<
2149  " // next state\n" <<
2150  " always @(*)\n" <<
2151  " begin\n" <<
2152  " case (y_Q)\n" <<
2153  " s_WAIT: if (go) Y_D = s_START; else Y_D = y_Q;\n" <<
2154  "\n" <<
2155  " s_START: Y_D = s_EXE;\n" <<
2156  "\n" <<
2157  " s_EXE: if (!finish) Y_D = s_EXE; else Y_D = s_DONE;\n" <<
2158  "\n" <<
2159  " s_DONE: Y_D = s_DONE;\n" <<
2160  "\n" <<
2161  " default: Y_D = 3'bxxx;\n" <<
2162  " endcase\n" <<
2163  " end\n" <<
2164  "\n" <<
2165  " // current state\n" <<
2166  " always @(posedge clk)\n" <<
2167  " begin\n" <<
2168  " if (reset) // synchronous clear\n" <<
2169  " y_Q <= s_WAIT;\n" <<
2170  " else\n" <<
2171  " y_Q <= Y_D;\n" <<
2172  " end\n" <<
2173  "\n" <<
2174  " always @(posedge clk)\n" <<
2175  " if (y_Q == s_EXE && finish)\n" <<
2176  " return_val_reg <= return_val;\n" <<
2177  " else if (y_Q == s_DONE)\n" <<
2178  " return_val_reg <= return_val_reg;\n" <<
2179  " else\n" <<
2180  " return_val_reg <= 0;\n" <<
2181  "\n" <<
2182  "\n" <<
2183  " assign start = (y_Q == s_START);\n";
2184  }
2185 
2186  Out <<
2187  "endmodule\n" <<
2188  "\n";

7513  {
7514  int tag_bits = requiredBits(alloc->getNumRAMs() + 1);
7515 
7516  int offset_bits = 0;
7517  for (Allocation::const_ram_iterator RI = alloc->ram_begin(),

7521 
7522  int max_offset = requiredBits(ram->getElements() - 1);
7523  max_offset += (int)log2(ram->getDataWidth() / 8);
7524 
7525  offset_bits = max(offset_bits, max_offset);
7526  }
7527 
7528  Out << "hlsd\n";
7529  Out << "#(\n";
7530  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->isXilinxBoard())
7531  Out << ".FPGA_VENDOR(\"Xilinx\"),\n";
7532  else
7533  Out << ".FPGA_VENDOR(\"Altera\"),\n";
7534 
7535  if (alloc->getDbgInfo()->getOptionTraceRegs())
7536  Out << ".OPTION_TRACE_REGS(1),\n";
7537  else
7538  Out << ".OPTION_TRACE_REGS(0),\n";
7539 
7540  if (alloc->getDbgInfo()->getOptionRegBufferDualPorted())
7541  Out << ".OPTION_TRACE_REGS_DUAL_PORTED(1),\n";
7542  else
7543  Out << ".OPTION_TRACE_REGS_DUAL_PORTED(0),\n";
7544 
7545  if (alloc->getDbgInfo()->getOptionSupportsReadFromMem()) {
7546  Out << ".OPTION_MEMORY_READ_AT_TRIGGER(1),\n";
7547  Out << ".OPTION_MEMORY_READ_THEN_RESUME(1),\n";
7548  }
7549 
7550  Out << ".MEMORY_CONTROLLER_ADDR_SIZE(`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_ADDR_SIZE),\n";
7551  Out << ".MEMORY_CONTROLLER_DATA_SIZE(`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_DATA_SIZE),\n";
7552  Out << ".SYSTEM_ID("
7553  << "32'h" << std::hex << alloc->getDbgInfo()->getSystemID() << std::dec
7554  << "),\n";
7555  Out << ".MEM_TAG_BITS(" << tag_bits << "),\n";
7556  Out << ".MEM_OFFSET_BITS(" << offset_bits << "),\n";
7557 
7558  Out << ".CONTROL_BUFFER_DEPTH(" << alloc->getDbgInfo()->getTraceCtrlDepth()
7559  << "),\n";
7560  Out << ".DATA_BUFFER_DEPTH(" << alloc->getDbgInfo()->getTraceMemDepth()
7561  << "),\n";
7562  Out << ".REGS_BUFFER_DEPTH(" << alloc->getDbgInfo()->getTraceRegsDepth()
7563  << "),\n";
7564 
7565  int regsWidth = max(alloc->getDbgInfo()->getRegsTraceBits(), 1);
7566  Out << ".REGS_WIDTH(" << regsWidth << "),\n";
7567  Out << ".PC_MODULE_BITS(" << alloc->getDbgInfo()->getInstanceIdBits()
7568  << "),\n";
7569  Out << ".PC_STATE_BITS(" << alloc->getDbgInfo()->getStateBits() << ")\n";
7570 
7571  Out << ")\n";
7572  Out << "hlsd_inst\n";
7573  Out << "(\n";
7574  Out << ".clk(clk),\n";
7575  Out << ".reset(reset),\n";
7576  Out << ".start(debugger_start),\n";
7577  Out << ".finish(finish),\n";
7578  Out << ".program_clk(program_clk),\n";
7579  Out << ".program_reset(program_reset),\n";
7580  Out << ".pc_module(" << DEBUG_SIGNAL_NAME_ACTIVE_INST << "),\n";
7581  Out << ".pc_state(" << DEBUG_SIGNAL_NAME_CURRENT_STATE << "),\n";
7582  Out << ".memory_controller_enable_a(memory_controller_enable_a),\n";
7583  Out << ".memory_controller_enable_b(memory_controller_enable_b),\n";
7584  Out << ".memory_controller_address_a(memory_controller_address_a),\n";
7585  Out << ".memory_controller_address_b(memory_controller_address_b),\n";
7586  Out << ".memory_controller_write_enable_a(memory_controller_write_enable_a)"
7587  ",\n";
7588  Out << ".memory_controller_write_enable_b(memory_controller_write_enable_b)"
7589  ",\n";
7590  Out << ".memory_controller_in_a(memory_controller_in_a),\n";
7591  Out << ".memory_controller_in_b(memory_controller_in_b),\n";
7592  Out << ".memory_controller_out_a(memory_controller_out_a),\n";
7593  Out << ".memory_controller_out_b(memory_controller_out_b),\n";
7594  Out << ".memory_controller_size_a(memory_controller_size_a),\n";
7595  Out << ".memory_controller_size_b(memory_controller_size_b),\n";
7596  Out << ".main_enable_a(main_memory_controller_enable_a),\n";
7597  Out << ".main_enable_b(main_memory_controller_enable_b),\n";
7598  Out << ".main_address_a(main_memory_controller_address_a),\n";
7599  Out << ".main_address_b(main_memory_controller_address_b),\n";
7600  Out << ".main_write_enable_a(main_memory_controller_write_enable_a),\n";
7601  Out << ".main_write_enable_b(main_memory_controller_write_enable_b),\n";
7602  Out << ".main_in_a(main_memory_controller_in_a),\n";
7603  Out << ".main_in_b(main_memory_controller_in_b),\n";
7604  Out << ".main_out_a(main_memory_controller_out_a),\n";
7605  Out << ".main_out_b(main_memory_controller_out_b),\n";
7606  Out << ".main_size_a(main_memory_controller_size_a),\n";
7607  Out << ".main_size_b(main_memory_controller_size_b),\n";
7608 
7609  if (alloc->getDbgInfo()->getOptionTraceRegs()) {
7610  Out << ".regs_trace_wr_en_a(" << DEBUG_SIGNAL_NAME_TRACE_REGS_EN
7611  << "_a),\n";
7612  Out << ".regs_trace_wr_en_b(" << DEBUG_SIGNAL_NAME_TRACE_REGS_EN
7613  << "_b),\n";
7614  Out << ".regs_trace(" << DEBUG_SIGNAL_NAME_TRACE_REGS << "),\n";
7615  } else {
7616  Out << ".regs_trace_wr_en_a(1'b0),\n";
7617  Out << ".regs_trace_wr_en_b(1'b0),\n";
7618  Out << ".regs_trace(),\n";
7619  }
7620 
7621  Out << ".uart_rx(uart_rx),\n";
7622  Out << ".uart_tx(uart_tx),\n";
7623  Out << ".hlsd_state(hlsd_state),\n";
7624  Out << ".external_start(start)\n";
7625  Out << ");\n";
7626  Out << "\n";
7627 }

1390  {
1391 
1392  Out << "// synthesis translate_off\n";
1393  Out << "module legup_memory_transaction_monitor #(\n"
1394  << "\tparameter DW = `MEMORY_CONTROLLER_DATA_SIZE-1,\n"
1395  << "\tparameter AW = `MEMORY_CONTROLLER_ADDR_SIZE-1,\n\n"
1396  <<
1397 
1398  "\tparameter NUM_READS = 1000000,\n"
1399  << "\tparameter NUM_WRITES = 1000000,\n\n"
1400  <<
1401 
1402  "\tparameter CAPTURE_TRANSACTIONS = 1,\n\n"
1403  <<
1404 
1405  "\tparameter READ_ADDRESS_FILENAME = \"read_addresses.dat\",\n"
1406  << "\tparameter READ_DATA_FILENAME = \"read_data.dat\",\n"
1407  << "\tparameter WRITE_ADDRESS_FILENAME = \"write_addresses.dat\",\n"
1408  << "\tparameter WRITE_DATA_FILENAME = \"write_data.dat\"\n"
1409  << ") (\n"
1410  << "\tinput clk,\n"
1411  << "\tinput [AW: 0] address,\n"
1412  << "\tinput read,\n"
1413  << "\tinput write,\n"
1414  << "\tinput [DW: 0] writedata,\n"
1415  << "\tinput [DW: 0] readdata,\n"
1416  << "\tinput readdatavalid,\n"
1417  << "\tinput waitrequest\n"
1418  << ");\n\n"
1419  <<
1420 
1421  "reg [31: 0] read_address_file_handle;\n"
1422  << "reg [31: 0] read_data_file_handle;\n"
1423  << "reg [31: 0] write_address_file_handle;\n"
1424  << "reg [31: 0] write_data_file_handle;\n\n"
1425  <<
1426 
1427  "reg [31: 0] address_reads;\n"
1428  << "reg [31: 0] data_reads;\n"
1429  << "reg [31: 0] reads_addresses [NUM_READS:0];\n"
1430  << "reg [DW: 0] reads_data [NUM_READS:0];\n"
1431  << "reg [31: 0] writes;\n"
1432  << "reg [31: 0] writes_addresses [NUM_WRITES:0];\n"
1433  << "reg [DW: 0] writes_data [NUM_WRITES:0];\n\n"
1434  <<
1435 
1436  "initial\n"
1437  << "begin\n"
1438  << "\tif (CAPTURE_TRANSACTIONS == 1)\n"
1439  << "\tbegin\n"
1440  << "\t\tread_address_file_handle = $fopen (READ_ADDRESS_FILENAME);\n"
1441  << "\t\tread_data_file_handle = $fopen (READ_DATA_FILENAME);\n"
1442  << "\t\twrite_address_file_handle = $fopen "
1443  "(WRITE_ADDRESS_FILENAME);\n"
1444  << "\t\twrite_data_file_handle = $fopen (WRITE_DATA_FILENAME);\n"
1445  << "\tend\n"
1446  << "\telse\n"
1447  << "\tbegin\n"
1448  << "\t\t$readmemh(READ_ADDRESS_FILENAME, reads_addresses);\n"
1449  << "\t\t$readmemh(READ_DATA_FILENAME, reads_data);\n"
1450  << "\t\t$readmemh(WRITE_ADDRESS_FILENAME, writes_addresses);\n"
1451  << "\t\t$readmemh(WRITE_DATA_FILENAME, writes_data);\n"
1452  << "\tend\n\n"
1453  <<
1454 
1455  "\taddress_reads <= 32'd0;\n"
1456  << "\tdata_reads <= 32'd0;\n"
1457  << "\twrites <= 32'd0;\n"
1458  << "end\n"
1459  << "always @(posedge clk)\n"
1460  << "begin\n"
1461  << "\tif (CAPTURE_TRANSACTIONS == 1)\n"
1462  << "\tbegin\n"
1463  << "\t\tif (read & ~waitrequest)\n"
1464  << "\t\tbegin\n"
1465  << "\t\t\t$fwrite (read_address_file_handle, \"%x\\n\", address);\n"
1466  << "\t\t\t$fflush (read_address_file_handle);\n"
1467  << "\t\t\taddress_reads <= address_reads + 1;\n"
1468  << "\t\tend\n"
1469  << "\t\tif (readdatavalid & ~waitrequest)\n"
1470  << "\t\tbegin\n"
1471  << "\t\t\t$fwrite (read_data_file_handle, \"%x\\n\", readdata);\n"
1472  << "\t\t\t$fflush (read_data_file_handle);\n"
1473  << "\t\t\tdata_reads <= data_reads + 1;\n"
1474  << "\t\tend\n"
1475  << "\t\tif (write & ~waitrequest)\n"
1476  << "\t\tbegin\n"
1477  << "\t\t\t$fwrite (write_address_file_handle, \"%x\\n\", address);\n"
1478  << "\t\t\t$fwrite (write_data_file_handle, \"%x\\n\", writedata);\n"
1479  << "\t\t\t$fflush (write_address_file_handle);\n"
1480  << "\t\t\t$fflush (write_data_file_handle);\n"
1481  << "\t\t\twrites <= writes + 1;\n"
1482  << "\t\tend\n"
1483  << "\tend\n"
1484  << "\telse\n"
1485  << "\tbegin\n"
1486  << "\t\tif (read & ~waitrequest)\n"
1487  << "\t\tbegin\n"
1488  << "\t\t\tif (reads_addresses[address_reads] != address)\n"
1489  << "\t\t\tbegin\n"
1490  << "\t\t\t\t$display (\"Read %d has an address error !\\n\", "
1491  "address_reads + 1);\n"
1492  << "\t\t\t\t$display (\"Expected transaction address: %08x\", "
1493  "reads_addresses[address_reads]);\n"
1494  << "\t\t\t\t$display (\"Actual transaction address: %08x\\n\", "
1495  "address);\n"
1496  << "\t\t\t\t$stop;\n"
1497  << "\t\t\tend\n"
1498  << "\t\t\t address_reads <= address_reads + 1;\n"
1499  << "\t\tend\n"
1500  << "\t\tif (readdatavalid & ~waitrequest)\n"
1501  << "\t\tbegin\n"
1502  << "\t\t\tif (reads_data[data_reads] != readdata)\n"
1503  << "\t\t\tbegin\n"
1504  << "\t\t\t\t$display (\"Read %d has an data error !\\n\", data_reads + "
1505  "1);\n"
1506  << "\t\t\t\t$display (\"Expected transaction data: %08x\", "
1507  "reads_data[data_reads]);\n"
1508  << "\t\t\t\t$display (\"Actual transaction data: %08x\", "
1509  "readdata);\n"
1510  << "\t\t\t\t$stop;\n"
1511  << "\t\t\tend\n"
1512  << "\t\t\tdata_reads <= data_reads + 1;\n"
1513  << "\t\tend\n"
1514  << "\t\tif (write & ~waitrequest)\n"
1515  << "\t\tbegin\n"
1516  << "\t\t\tif ((writes_addresses[writes] != address) || "
1517  "(writes_data[writes] != writedata))\n"
1518  << "\t\t\tbegin\n"
1519  << "\t\t\t\t$display (\"Write %d has an error!\\n\", writes + 1);\n"
1520  << "\t\t\t\t$display (\"Expected transaction address: %08x\", "
1521  "writes_addresses[writes]);\n"
1522  << "\t\t\t\t$display (\"Actual transaction address: %08x\", "
1523  "address);\n"
1524  << "\t\t\t\t$display (\"Expected transaction data: %08x\", "
1525  "writes_data[writes]);\n"
1526  << "\t\t\t\t$display (\"Actual transaction data: %08x\\n\", "
1527  "writedata);\n"
1528  << "\t\t\t\t$stop;\n"
1529  << "\t\t\tend\n"
1530  << "\t\t\twrites <= writes + 1;\n"
1531  << "\t\tend\n"
1532  << "\tend\n"
1533  << "end\n"
1534  <<
1535 
1536  "endmodule\n";
1537  Out << "// synthesis translate_on\n\n";
1538 }

4705  << "always @(posedge clk)\n"

void legup::VerilogWriter::printDeclaration ( const RTLSignal *  signal)

Definition at line 6505 of file VerilogWriter.cpp.

6505  {
6506  std::string type = signal->getType();
6507  if (!type.empty()) {
6508  if (type == "wire" &&
6509  (signal->getNumConditions() != 0 || signal->getNumDrivers() != 0)) {
6510  Out << "reg ";
6511  } else if (type == "output" && (signal->getNumConditions() != 0 ||
6512  signal->getNumDrivers() != 0)) {
6513  Out << "output reg ";
6514  } else {
6515  Out << type << " ";
6516  }
6517  }
6518  Out << signal->getWidth().str() << " ";
6519  Out << signal->getName();
6520  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("CASE_FSM") &&
6521  signal->getName() == "cur_state")
6522  Out << ";\nreg " << signal->getWidth().str()
6523  << " next_state"; // need an extra variable if the FSM is
6524  // implemented with case(..)
6525  if (!signal->getValue().empty()) {
6526  Out << " = ";
6527  printVerilogBitwidthPrefix(signal);
6528  Out << signal->getValue();
6529  }
6530 
6531  if (type == "wire" && rtl->synthesis_keep_signal(signal->getName())) {
6532  Out << "/* synthesis keep */";
6533  }
6534 
6535  Out << ";";
6536 }

7315  op->getOpcode() == RTLOp::Display);
7316  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("PRINTF_CYCLES")) {
7317  Out << "$write(\"Cycle: %d Time: %d \", ($time-50)/20, $time);\n";
7318  }

7320  Out << "$write(";
7321  } else {
7322  Out << "$display(";
7323  }

7326  auto is_unsigned_vec = parseDisplayString(display_string);
7327  assert(is_unsigned_vec.size() == op->getNumOperands() - 1);
7328  // Print the display string, and with placeholders replaced to Verilog.
7329  printDisplayString(display_string);
7330 
7331  // Print the variables.
7332  for (unsigned i = 1; i < op->getNumOperands(); i++) {
7333  Out << ", ";
7334  if (!is_unsigned_vec[i-1]) {
7335  Out << "$signed(";
7336  }
7337  if (op->getOpcode() == RTLOp::Write && i == 1) {
7338  printValue(op->getOperand(i),
7339  op->getOperand(i)->getWidth().numNativeBits(rtl, alloc));
7340  } else {
7341  printValue(op->getOperand(i));
7342  }
7343  if (!is_unsigned_vec[i-1]) {
7344  Out << ")";
7345  }
7346  }
7347  Out << ")";
7348 
7349  if (op->getNumOperands() > 1 && !LEGUP_CONFIG->isXilinxBoard()) {
7350  Out << ";\n";
7351  Out << "\t\t// to fix quartus warning\n";
7352  // avoid getting a warning from quartus that we
7353  // never read the value being printed
7354  for (unsigned i = 1; i < op->getNumOperands(); i++) {
7355  // Out << "if (^reset !== 1'bX && ^(";
7356  Out << "\t\tif (reset == 1'b0 && ^(";
7357  printValue(op->getOperand(i));
7358  Out << ") === 1'bX) "
7359  << "finish <= 0";
7360  if (i != op->getNumOperands() - 1)
7361  Out << ";\n";
7362  }
7363  }
7364 }

void legup::VerilogWriter::printDisplayString ( std::string  display_string)

Definition at line 7256 of file VerilogWriter.cpp.

7256  {
7257  // Make sure \n gets represented properly
7258  replaceAll(display_string, "\n", "\\n");
7259 
7260  // ensure escaped % does not look like %x, %p, %u, etc...
7261  replaceAll(display_string, "%%", "%?");
7262 
7263  replaceAll(display_string, "%016llx", "%0x");
7264 
7265  // convert printf format specifiers to $display format
7266  // specifiers
7267  // %0x prints the minimum hex characters - seems to match C better
7268  replaceAll(display_string, "%x", "%0x");
7269  replaceAll(display_string, "%p", "%0x");
7270  replaceAll(display_string, "%u", "%d");
7271  // long long
7272  replaceAll(display_string, "%lld", "%d");
7273  replaceAll(display_string, "%llu", "%d");
7274  replaceAll(display_string, "%llx", "%0x");
7275  // long
7276  replaceAll(display_string, "%ld", "%d");
7277  replaceAll(display_string, "%lu", "%d");
7278  replaceAll(display_string, "%lx", "%0x");
7279  // short
7280  replaceAll(display_string, "%hd", "%d");
7281  replaceAll(display_string, "%hu", "%d");
7282  replaceAll(display_string, "%hx", "%0x");
7283  // very short
7284  replaceAll(display_string, "%hhd", "%d");
7285  replaceAll(display_string, "%hhu", "%d");
7286  replaceAll(display_string, "%hhx", "%0x");
7287 
7288  // go back to escaped %
7289  replaceAll(display_string, "%?", "%%");
7290 
7291  // Print.
7292  Out << display_string;
7293 }

Definition at line 6894 of file VerilogWriter.cpp.

6897  {
6898 
6899  bool reg = signal->isReg();
6900  unsigned sigWidth = signal->getWidth().numBits(rtl, alloc);
6901  int numConditions = signal->getNumConditions();
6902 
6903  const RTLSignal *driver = signal->getDriver(conditionNum);
6904  const RTLSignal *condition = signal->getCondition(conditionNum);
6905  const std::string driverBits = driver->getDriverBits();
6906  assert(driver);
6907  const Instruction *I = signal->getInst(conditionNum);
6908 
6909  if (printCmnts)
6910  printComments(I, "\t");
6911 
6912  // don't "else" if the signal is not synthesizable, if it is a reg or
6913  // if it has a default driver
6914  bool no_else = (signal == rtl->getUnsynthesizableSignal()) || reg ||
6915  signal->getDefaultDriver();
6916 
6917  bool ifcond = false;
6918  if (no_else) {
6919  Out << "\tif (";
6920  printValue(condition);
6921  Out << ") ";
6922  ifcond = true;
6923  } else { // add "else"s
6924  if (numConditions > 1) {
6925  if (numConditions > 1 && conditionNum == numConditions - 1) {
6926  Out << "\telse ";
6927  Out << "/* if (";
6928  printValue(condition);
6929  Out << ") */ ";
6930  } else {
6931  if (conditionNum > 0) {
6932  Out << "\telse if (";
6933  } else {
6934  Out << "\tif (";
6935  }
6936  printValue(condition);
6937  Out << ") ";
6938  }
6939  ifcond = true;
6940  } else {
6941  printAlwaysTrigger(signal, driver);
6942  }
6943  }
6944 
6945  if (ifcond)
6946  Out << "begin\n";
6947  Out << "\t\t";
6948  if (signal != rtl->getUnsynthesizableSignal()) {
6949  Out << signal->getName() << driverBits << " " << assignOp << " ";
6950  }
6951  printValue(driver, sigWidth, false);
6952  Out << ";\n";
6953 
6954  // debugging
6955  // assert that we never assign an X to a variable
6956  // Note: need === instead of ==
6957  // xor (^) catches cases where the X is only in part of the signal
6958  if (!LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("VSIM_NO_ASSERT") && reg &&
6959  signal->getCheckXs()) {
6960  // only check after the module has started
6961  // the start signal is high for one cycle then goes low
6962  Out << "\t\tif (start == 1'b0 && ^(";
6963  // Out << "\t\tif (reset == 1'b0 && ^(";
6964  printValue(driver, sigWidth);
6965  Out << ") === 1'bX) begin "
6966  << "$display (\"ERROR: Right hand side is 'X'. Assigned to "
6967  << signal->getName() << "\");"
6968  << " $finish; end\n";
6969  }
6970 
6971  if (ifcond)
6972  Out << "\tend\n";
6973 }

2275  << "input [(width_b-1):0] data_b;\n"
2276  << "// byte enable is unsupported by inferred RAMs\n"
2277  << "input [width_be_a-1:0] byteena_a;\n"
2278  << "input [width_be_b-1:0] byteena_b;\n";
2279  }
2280  Out << "\n" <<
2281  // ramstyle = \"M9K, no_rw_check\"
2282  "(* ramstyle = \"no_rw_check\", ram_init_file = init_file *) "
2283  << "reg [width_a-1:0] ram[numwords_a-1:0];\n"
2284  << "\n"
2285  << "/* synthesis translate_off */\n"
2286  << "integer i;\n"
2287  << "ALTERA_MF_MEMORY_INITIALIZATION mem ();\n"
2288  << "reg [8*256:1] ram_ver_file;\n"
2289  << "initial begin\n"
2290  << " if (init_file == \"UNUSED.mif\")\n"
2291  << " begin\n"
2292  << " for (i = 0; i < numwords_a; i = i + 1)\n"
2293  << " ram[i] = 0;\n"
2294  << " end\n"
2295  << " else\n"
2296  << " begin\n"
2297  << " // modelsim can't read .mif files directly. So use Altera "
2298  "function to\n"
2299  << " // convert them to .ver files\n"
2300  << " mem.convert_to_ver_file(init_file, width_a, "
2301  "ram_ver_file);\n"
2302  << " $readmemh(ram_ver_file, ram);\n"
2303  << " end\n"
2304  << "end\n"
2305  << "/* synthesis translate_on */\n"
2306  << "\n";
2307  if (readonly) {
2308  Out << "always @ (posedge clk)\n"
2309  << "if (clken)\n"
2310  << "begin\n"
2311  << " q_a_wire <= ram[address_a];\n"
2312  << " q_b_wire <= ram[address_b];\n"
2313  << "end\n";
2314  } else {
2315  Out << "always @ (posedge clk)\n"
2316  << "if (clken)\n"
2317  << "begin // Port A\n"
2318  << "if (wren_a)\n"
2319  << "begin\n"
2320  << " ram[address_a] <= data_a;\n"
2321  << " q_a_wire <= {width_a{1'bX}};\n" <<
2322  // The below line doesn't synthesize on Cyclone II if widthad_a <= 3
2323  //" q_a_wire <= data_a;\n" <<
2324  "end\n"
2325  << "else\n"
2326  << " q_a_wire <= ram[address_a];\n";
2327  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameter("INFERRED_RAM_FORMAT") != "xilinx") {
2328  // Xilinx expects inferred dual port ram to be in a single always
2329  // block
2330  // Altera: separate always blocks
2331  Out << "end\n"
2332  << "always @ (posedge clk)\n"
2333  << "if (clken)\n"
2334  << "begin // Port b\n";
2335  }
2336  Out << "if (wren_b)\n"
2337  << "begin\n"
2338  << " ram[address_b] <= data_b;\n"
2339  << " q_b_wire <= {width_b{1'bX}};\n" <<
2340  // The below line doesn't synthesize on Cyclone II if widthad_a <= 3
2341  //" q_b_wire <= data_b;\n" <<
2342  "end\n"
2343  << "else\n"

2345  << "end\n";
2346  }
2347 
2348  Out << "\n" << getMemoryOutputRegisters() << "\n"
2349  << "\n"
2350  << "endmodule\n";
2351 }

Definition at line 796 of file VerilogWriter.cpp.

796  {
797 
798  Out << "`timescale 1 ns / 1 ns\n"
799  << "module legup_HW_lock (\n"
800  << " clk,\n"
801  << " reset,\n"
802  << " address,\n"
803  << " read,\n"
804  << " write,\n"
805  << " readdata,\n"
806  << " writedata\n"
807  << ");\n"
808  << "\n"
809  << "input clk;\n"
810  << "input reset;\n"
811  << "input address;\n"
812  << "input read;\n"
813  << "input write;\n"
814  << "input writedata;\n"
815  << "output readdata; \n"
816  << "\n"
817  << "wire mutex_free;\n"
818  << "reg mutex_owner;\n"
819  << "reg mutex_status;\n"
820  << "wire owner_valid;\n"
821  << "wire accel_id;\n"
822  << "\n"
823  << "assign accel_id = writedata;\n"
824  << "\n"
825  << "always @(posedge clk)\n"
826  << "begin\n"
827  << " if (reset)\n"
828  << " begin\n"
829  << " mutex_status <= 0;\n"
830  << " mutex_owner <= 0;\n"
831  << " end\n"
832  << " //if mutex is free and someone tries to get the mutex\n"
833  << " else if (mutex_free && read && !address)\n"
834  << " begin\n"
835  << " mutex_status <= 1;\n"
836  << " mutex_owner <= 1;\n"
837  << " end\n"
838  << " //if mutex is taken and the owner wants to release the mutex\n"
839  << " else if (owner_valid && write && address)\n"
840  << " begin\n"
841  << " mutex_status <= 0;\n"
842  << " mutex_owner <= 0;\n"
843  << " end\n"
844  << "end\n"
845  << "\n"
846  << "assign readdata = mutex_free;\n"
847  << "assign mutex_free = mutex_status == 0;\n"
848  << "assign owner_valid = mutex_owner == accel_id;\n"
849  << "\n"
850  << "endmodule\n\n";
851 }

2960  int latency = getGlobalMemLatency();
2961  Out << "parameter latency = " << latency << ";\n\n";
2962  std::string ram_latency;
2963  if (latency == 1) {
2964  // special case -- we will remove the output register
2965  ram_latency = "latency";
2966  } else {
2967  // typical case -- memory_controller has an output register
2968  ram_latency = "latency-1";
2969  }
2970  Out << "parameter ram_latency = " << ram_latency << ";\n\n";
2971 
2972  Out << "integer j;\n";
2973 
2974  Out << ""
2975  << "\n"
2976  << "input clk;"
2977  << "\n";

3150  // pre_Tag is no longer needed here.
3151  Out << "assign tag" << postfix << " = "
3152  << "memory_controller_address" << postfix << "["
3153  << "`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_ADDR_SIZE-1"
3154  << ":"

3156 
3157  // detect a TAG of 0 -- this can indicate that we are trying to read a local
3158  // RAM from the global memory which is impossible. Use:
3159  // set_memory_global <ram_name>
3160  // to force the local ram to global memory
3161  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("LOCAL_RAMS")) {
3162  Out << "always @(*)\n"
3163  << "if (memory_controller_enable" << postfix << " & (tag" << postfix
3164  << " == 0))\n"
3165  << "begin\n"
3166  << " $display(\"Error: Null pointer exception! "
3167  << "Are you trying to read from a local ram? Use: "
3168  << "'set_memory_global <ram_name>' To debug this error try: "
3169  << "'set_parameter PRINT_STATES 1'\");\n"
3170  << " $finish;\n"
3171  << "end\n";
3172  }

void legup::VerilogWriter::printMemoryStateMachine ( )
private

Definition at line 5643 of file VerilogWriter.cpp.

5643  {
5644  // print memory controller state machine for 2 Avalon memory accesses per
5645  // cycle
5646  // state_a is the initial state, where there may be two memory accesses from
5647  // both ports
5648  // if there are, then it's the state when port a would be given access
5649  // state_b is the state where port b is given access
5650  Out << "always @(posedge clk)\n"
5651  << "begin\n"
5652  << "\tif (reset) begin\n"
5653  << "\t\tmemory_controller_state <= state_a;\n"
5654  << "\tend else begin\n"
5655  << "\t\tcase (memory_controller_state)\n"
5656  << "\t\t\tstate_a: begin\n";
5657  Out << "\t\t\t\tif (flag_to_sharedMemory_reg_a && "
5658  "flag_to_sharedMemory_reg_b && !av_waitrequest)";
5659  Out << "\n"
5660  << "\t\t\t\t\tmemory_controller_state <= state_b;\n"
5661  << "\t\t\tend\n"
5662  << "\t\t\tstate_b: begin\n" <<
5663  //"\t\t\t\tif (!avm_ACCEL_waitrequest)\n"<<
5664  "\t\t\t\tif (!av_waitrequest)\n"
5665  << "\t\t\t\t\tmemory_controller_state <= state_a;\n"
5666  << "\t\t\tend\n"
5667  << "\t\tendcase\n"
5668  << "\tend\n"
5669  << "end\n";
5670  /*
5671  Out << "always @(posedge clk)\n"<<
5672  "begin\n"<<

5677  "\t\t\tstateIDLE: begin\n";
5678  Out << "\t\t\t\tif (flag_to_sharedMemory_reg_a &&
5679  flag_to_sharedMemory_reg_b)";

5686  "\t\t\t\t\tmemory_controller_state <= stateSECOND;\n"<<

2584  if (alloc->usesGenericRAMs()) {
2585  Out << outputPrefix << " [1:0] " << busName << "_size" << postfix
2586  << ";\n";
2587  }
2588  Out << inputPrefix << " [`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_DATA_SIZE-1:0] " << busName
2589  << "_out" << postfix << ";\n";
2590  Out << "\n";
2591 }

6450  if (alloc->getDbgInfo()->isDebugRtlEnabled()) {
6451  // Add Verilog function that determines the Instance ID of this module,
6452  // given
6453  // its parent instance ID.
6454  const map<int, int> *instanceMapping = rtl->dbgGetInstanceMapping();
6455  if (instanceMapping->begin() != instanceMapping->end()) {
6456  int instanceBitMax = alloc->getDbgInfo()->getInstanceIdBits() - 1;
6457  Out << "function [" << instanceBitMax << ":0] "
6458  << DEBUG_VERILOG_FUNC_NAME_INSTANCE_MAPPING << ";\n";
6459  Out << "\tinput [" << instanceBitMax << ":0] parentInstance;\n";
6460  Out << "\tbegin\n";
6461  Out << "\t\t" << DEBUG_VERILOG_FUNC_NAME_INSTANCE_MAPPING
6462  << " = 0;\n";
6463  for (map<int, int>::const_iterator it = instanceMapping->begin(),
6464  it_end = instanceMapping->end();
6465  it != it_end; ++it) {
6466  if (it == instanceMapping->begin())
6467  Out << "\t\tif ";
6468  else
6469  Out << "\t\telse if ";
6470  Out << "(parentInstance == " << it->first << ")\n";
6471  Out << "\t\t\t" << DEBUG_VERILOG_FUNC_NAME_INSTANCE_MAPPING
6472  << " = " << it->second << ";\n";
6473  }
6474  Out << "\tend\n";
6475  Out << "endfunction\n\n";
6476  }
6477  }

6484  }

void legup::VerilogWriter::printMultipumpModule ( )
private

Definition at line 538 of file VerilogWriter.cpp.

538  {
539  // multiplier is clocked at 2x the system clock
540  int stages = 0;
541  LEGUP_CONFIG->getOperationLatency("signed_multiply", &stages);
542  assert(stages && "Must set multiplier latency for multipumping.");
543 
544  bool inputStage = (stages >= 3);
545  if (inputStage) {
546  // use one stage at the inputs
547  stages--;
548  }
549  unsigned lpm_pipeline = 2 * stages;
550 
551  Out << "module multipump (\n"
552  << "clk,\n"
553  << "clk2x,\n"
554  << "clk1x_follower,\n"
555  << "inA,\n"
556  << "inB,\n"
557  << "outAxB,\n"
558  << "inC,\n"
559  << "inD,\n"
560  << "clken,\n"
561  << "outCxD);\n"
562  << "\n"
563  << "parameter size = 32;\n"
564  << "parameter sign = \"UNSIGNED\";\n"
565  << "\n"
566  << "input clk, clk2x, clk1x_follower, clken;\n"
567  << "input [size-1:0] inA, inB, inC, inD;\n"
568  << "output reg [size*2-1:0] outAxB, outCxD;\n";
569  if (inputStage) {
570  Out << "reg [size-1:0] inAreg, inBreg, inCreg, inDreg;\n"
571  << "always @(posedge clk) begin\n"
572  << "inAreg <= inA;\n"
573  << "inBreg <= inB;\n"
574  << "inCreg <= inC;\n"
575  << "inDreg <= inD;\n"
576  << "end\n"
577  << "\n"
578  << "\n";
579  }
580  Out << "\n"
581  << "wire [size*2-1:0] dsp_out;\n"
582  << "reg [size*2-1:0] resultAB_reg, resultCD_reg;\n"
583  << "\n"
584  << "\n"
585  << "always @(*) begin\n"
586  << "outCxD = resultCD_reg;\n"
587  << "outAxB = resultAB_reg;\n"
588  << "end\n"
589  << "\n"
590  << "\n"
591  << "reg [size*2-1:0] dsp_out_fast;\n"
592  << "\n"
593  << "\n"
594  << "\n"
595  << "always @(posedge clk2x) begin\n"
596  << "dsp_out_fast <= dsp_out;\n"
597  << "end\n"
598  << "\n"
599  << "\n"
600  << "// the C x D result is ready\n"
601  << "always @(*) begin\n"
602  << "resultCD_reg <= dsp_out;\n"
603  << "end\n"
604  << "\n"
605  << "// the A x B result is ready\n"
606  << "always @(*) begin\n"
607  << "resultAB_reg <= dsp_out_fast;\n"
608  << "end\n"
609  << "\n"
610  << "\n"
611  << "\n"
612  << "wire mux_sel;\n"
613  << "\n"
614  << "\n"
615  << "assign mux_sel = ~clk1x_follower;\n"
616  << "\n"
617  << "reg [size-1:0] dataa;\n"
618  << "reg [size-1:0] datab;\n"
619  << "wire [size-1:0] dataa_wire;\n"
620  << "wire [size-1:0] datab_wire;\n"
621  << "assign dataa_wire = dataa;\n"
622  << "assign datab_wire = datab;\n"
623  << "\n"
624  << "always @(*)\n"
625  << "begin\n"
626  << "if (mux_sel == 0) \n"
627  << "begin\n";
628  if (inputStage) {
629  Out << "dataa = inAreg;\n"
630  << "datab = inBreg;\n";
631  } else {
632  Out << "dataa = inA;\n"
633  << "datab = inB;\n";
634  }
635  Out << "end\n"
636  << "else \n"
637  << "begin\n";
638  if (inputStage) {
639  Out << "dataa = inCreg;\n"
640  << "datab = inDreg;\n";
641  } else {
642  Out << "dataa = inC;\n"
643  << "datab = inD;\n";
644  }
645  Out << "end\n"
646  << "end\n"
647  << "\n"
648  << "\n"
649  << "\n"
650  << "// DSP multiplier - has two pipeline stages, so both inputs and "
651  "outputs\n"
652  << "// are registered\n"
653  << "lpm_mult lpm_mult_component (\n";
654  if (lpm_pipeline == 0) {
655  Out << ".clock (),\n";
656  } else {
657  Out << ".clock (clk2x),\n";
658  }
659  Out << ".dataa (dataa_wire),\n"
660  << ".datab (datab_wire),\n"
661  << ".result (dsp_out),\n"
662  << ".aclr (1'b0),\n"
663  << ".clken (1'b1),\n"
664  << ".sum (1'b0));\n"
665  << "\n"
666  << "defparam\n"
667  << "lpm_mult_component.lpm_hint = "
668  "\"DEDICATED_MULTIPLIER_CIRCUITRY=YES,MAXIMIZE_SPEED=5\",\n"
669  << "lpm_mult_component.lpm_representation = sign,\n"
670  << "lpm_mult_component.lpm_type = \"LPM_MULT\",\n"
671  << "lpm_mult_component.lpm_pipeline = " << lpm_pipeline << ",\n"
672  << "lpm_mult_component.lpm_widtha = size,\n"
673  << "lpm_mult_component.lpm_widthb = size,\n"
674  << "lpm_mult_component.lpm_widthp = size*2;\n"
675  << "\n"
676  << "\n"
677  << "endmodule\n";
678 }

3872  for (int i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
3873  int dataSize = 0;
3874  int prevRamOutLo = 0;
3875  int prevRamOutHi = 0;
3876  switch (i) {
3877  case 0:
3878  // long long
3879  dataSize = 64;
3880  break;
3881  case 1:
3882  case 2:
3883  case 3:
3884  case 4:
3885  // int
3886  dataSize = 32;
3887  break;
3888  case 5:
3889  case 6:
3890  // short
3891  dataSize = 16;
3892  break;
3893  case 7:
3894  // byte
3895  dataSize = 8;
3896  break;
3897  default:
3898  llvm_unreachable(0);
3899  }

3902  prevRamOutHi = i * 8 + dataSize;

3696  std::set<PhysicalRAM *> visited;
3697  for (Allocation::const_ram_iterator i = alloc->ram_begin(),
3698  e = alloc->ram_end();
3699  i != e; ++i) {
3700  RAM *R = *i;
3701  if (stripRAM(R))
3702  continue;
3703  if (R->isStruct())
3704  continue;
3705  unsigned datawidth = R->getDataWidth();
3706  std::string name = R->getName();
3707 
3708  if (R->getScope() == RAM::LOCAL)
3709  continue;
3710

3712  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("GROUP_RAMS")) {
3713  PhysicalRAM *phyRAM = R->getPhysicalRAM();
3714  assert(phyRAM);
3715  if (visited.count(phyRAM))
3716  continue;
3717  visited.insert(phyRAM);
3718 
3719  name = phyRAM->getName();
3720  }
3721 
3722  int bytes = datawidth / 8;
3723  int ignore = (bytes == 0) ? 0 : (int)log2(bytes);
3724  if (ignore > 0) {
3725  // We do not support reading a single byte from an integer etc.
3726  // all pointers must be aligned to the word size of the ram
3727  // NOTE: memory_controller_address can be temporarily wrong
3728  // (due to being a combination signal) so we check the
3729  // prevAddr register instead
3730  unsigned numInstances = R->getNumInstances();

3732  std::string instanceName = "";
3733  if (numInstances != 1)
3734  instanceName = "_inst" + utostr(i);
3735 
3736  Out << " | {" << ignore << "{select_" << name + instanceName

3746  << "[2:0] != 0 && memory_controller_enable" << postfix << ")\n";
3747  Out << indent0 << "begin\n";
3748  Out << indent0 << "\t$display(\"Error: memory address not "
3749  << "aligned to ram word size!\");\n";
3750  Out << indent0 << "\t$finish;\n";
3751  Out << indent0 << "end\n\n";

935  << "\t\tgnt = {n{1'b0}};\n"
936  << "\t\tfor (i=n-1; i>=0; i=i-1) begin\n"
937  << "\t\t\tif (req[i]) begin\n"
938  << "\t\t\t\tgnt[i] = 1'b1;\n"
939  << "\t\t\t\tdisable priorityArbiter;\n"
940  << "\t\t\tend\n"
941  << "\t\tend\n"
942  << "\tend\n"
943  << "end\n"
944  << "\n"

void legup::VerilogWriter::printRamInstance ( RAM *  R)

Definition at line 3001 of file VerilogWriter.cpp.

3001  {
3002 
3003  // there can be multiple instances of the RAM
3004  // if it is used by parallel threads
3005  unsigned numInstances = R->getNumInstances();
3006  for (unsigned i = 0; i < numInstances; ++i) {
3007  std::string name = R->getName();
3008  if (numInstances != 1)
3009  name += "_inst" + utostr(i);
3010 
3011  unsigned addresswidth = R->getAddrWidth();
3012  unsigned datawidth = R->getDataWidth();
3013  unsigned numwords = R->getElements();
3014 
3015  PhysicalRAM *phyRAM = R->getPhysicalRAM();
3016  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("GROUP_RAMS") && phyRAM) {
3017  static std::set<PhysicalRAM *> visited;
3018  if (visited.count(phyRAM))
3019  return;
3020  visited.insert(phyRAM);
3021 
3022  numwords = phyRAM->getNumWords();
3023  name = phyRAM->getName();
3024  addresswidth = requiredBits(numwords - 1);
3025  }
3026 
3027  Out << "\n";
3028 
3029  if (R->getScope() == RAM::GLOBAL) {
3030  // this is a global RAM
3031 
3032  Out << "reg [" << addresswidth - 1 << ":0] " << name << "_address_a"
3033  << ";\n";
3034  Out << "reg [" << addresswidth - 1 << ":0] " << name << "_address_b"
3035  << ";\n";
3036  Out << "reg " << name << "_write_enable_a"
3037  << ";\n";
3038  Out << "reg " << name << "_write_enable_b"
3039  << ";\n";
3040  Out << "reg [" << datawidth - 1 << ":0] " << name << "_in_a"
3041  << ";\n";
3042  Out << "reg [" << datawidth - 1 << ":0] " << name << "_in_b"
3043  << ";\n";
3044  Out << "wire [" << datawidth - 1 << ":0] " << name << "_out_a"
3045  << ";\n";
3046  Out << "wire [" << datawidth - 1 << ":0] " << name << "_out_b"
3047  << ";\n";
3048 
3049  if (alloc->usesGenericRAMs() && R->isStruct()) {
3050  // if R is Struct
3051  Out << "reg [8-1:0] " << name << "_byteena_a;\n";
3052  Out << "reg [8-1:0] " << name << "_byteena_b;\n";
3053  }
3054  Out << "\n";
3055  }
3056 
3057  std::string comment = getValueStr(R->getValue());
3058  limitString(comment, 200);
3059  Out << "// " << comment << '\n';
3060 
3061  std::string type = (R->isROM()) ? "rom" : "ram";
3062  Out << type << "_dual_port " << name << " ("
3063  << "\n"
3064  << "\t"
3065  << ".clk( clk ),"
3066  << "\n"
3067  << "\t"
3068  << ".clken( !memory_controller_waitrequest ),"
3069  << "\n"
3070  << "\t"
3071  << ".address_a( " << name << "_address_a ),"
3072  << "\n"
3073  << "\t"
3074  << ".address_b( " << name << "_address_b ),"
3075  << "\n";
3076  if (!R->isROM()) {
3077  Out << "\t"
3078  << ".wren_a( " << name << "_write_enable_a ),"
3079  << "\n"
3080  << "\t"
3081  << ".wren_b( " << name << "_write_enable_b ),"
3082  << "\n"
3083  << "\t"
3084  << ".data_a( " << name << "_in_a ),"
3085  << "\n"
3086  << "\t"
3087  << ".data_b( " << name << "_in_b ),"
3088  << "\n";
3089  if (alloc->usesGenericRAMs()) {
3090  if (R->isStruct()) { // if R is Struct
3091  Out << "\t"
3092  << ".byteena_a( " << name << "_byteena_a ),"
3093  << "\n";
3094  Out << "\t"
3095  << ".byteena_b( " << name << "_byteena_b ),"
3096  << "\n";
3097  } else {
3098  Out << "\t"
3099  << ".byteena_a( 1'b1 ),"
3100  << "\n";
3101  Out << "\t"
3102  << ".byteena_b( 1'b1 ),"
3103  << "\n";
3104  }
3105  }
3106  }
3107  Out << "\t"
3108  << ".q_a( " << name << "_out_a )"
3109  << ",\n"
3110  << "\t"
3111  << ".q_b( " << name << "_out_b)"
3112  << "\n"
3113  << ");\n";
3114 
3115  // parameters
3116  Out << "defparam " << name << ".width_a = " << datawidth << ";\n";
3117  Out << "defparam " << name << ".width_b = " << datawidth << ";\n";
3118  Out << "defparam " << name << ".widthad_a = " << addresswidth << ";\n";
3119  Out << "defparam " << name << ".widthad_b = " << addresswidth << ";\n";
3120  if (!R->isROM()) {
3121  if (R->isStruct()) {
3122  Out << "defparam " << name << ".width_be_a = " << 8 << ";\n";
3123  Out << "defparam " << name << ".width_be_b = " << 8 << ";\n";
3124  } else if (alloc->usesGenericRAMs()) {
3125  Out << "defparam " << name << ".width_be_a = " << 1 << ";\n";
3126  Out << "defparam " << name << ".width_be_b = " << 1 << ";\n";
3127  }
3128  }
3129  Out << "defparam " << name << ".numwords_a = " << numwords << ";\n";
3130  Out << "defparam " << name << ".numwords_b = " << numwords << ";\n";
3131 
3132  if (R->getScope() == RAM::GLOBAL) {
3133  Out << "defparam " << name << ".latency = ram_latency;\n";
3134  } else {
3135  int latency = ((RAM *)R)->getLatency(alloc);
3136  Out << "defparam " << name << ".latency = " << latency << ";\n";
3137  }
3138 
3139  if (R->getInitializer()) {
3140  Out << "defparam " << name << ".init_file = ";
3141  Out << "\"" << R->getMifFileName() << "\";\n";
3142  }
3143  }
3144 }

2380  {
2381  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("INFERRED_RAMS") &&
2382  !alloc->structsExistInCode()) {
2383 
2384  // inferred RAMs don't work when you have an uninitialized
2385  // array. The Quartus synthesis directives are hard to parameterize.
2386  // Instead just make a zero mif file called UNUSED.mif
2387 
2388  std::string ErrorInfo;
2389  std::string mifname = "UNUSED.mif";
2390  raw_fd_ostream File(mifname.c_str(), ErrorInfo, llvm::sys::fs::F_None);
2391 
2392  if (!ErrorInfo.empty()) {
2393  errs() << "Error: " << ErrorInfo << '\n';
2394  assert(0);
2395  }
2396 
2397  File << "Depth = 1;\n"
2398  << "Width = 64;\n"
2399  << "Address_radix = dec;\n"
2400  << "Data_radix = hex;\n"
2401  << "Content\n"
2402  << "Begin\n" <<
2403  // even though we are missing entries here, Quartus will zero fill
2404  // the rest by default
2405  "0: 0;\n"
2406  << "End;\n";
2407 
2408  printInferredRAMModule(/*readonly=*/false);
2409  printInferredRAMModule(/*readonly=*/true);
2410  } else {
2411  assert(!LEGUP_CONFIG->isXilinxBoard());

3517  // different bytes.

3543  // then selects specific bits from
3544  // memory_controller_ALTSYNRAM_out_struct_a.

Definition at line 3306 of file VerilogWriter.cpp.

3306  {
3307  if (stripRAM(R))
3308  return;
3309 
3310  // there can be multiple instances of the RAM
3311  // if it is used by parallel threads
3312  unsigned numInstances = R->getNumInstances();
3313  for (unsigned i = 0; i < numInstances; ++i) {
3314  std::string name = R->getName();
3315  if (numInstances != 1)
3316  name += "_inst" + utostr(i);
3317 
3318  unsigned datawidth = R->getDataWidth();
3319  unsigned addresswidth = R->getAddrWidth();
3320 
3321  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("GROUP_RAMS")) {
3322 
3323  PhysicalRAM *phyRAM = R->getPhysicalRAM();
3324  assert(phyRAM);
3325  name = phyRAM->getName();
3326  addresswidth = requiredBits(phyRAM->getNumWords() - 1);
3327  }
3328 
3329  if (!R->isStruct()) {
3330 
3331  /*
3332  avalon_mem = memory_controller_address[5-1+2:0] + SRAM_offset;
3333  memory_controller_waitrequest = avalon_waitrequest;
3334  avalon_read = memory_controller_enable &
3335  ~memory_controller_write_enable;
3336  avalon_write = memory_controller_enable &
3337  memory_controller_write_enable;
3338  avalon_data = memory_controller_in[32-1:0];
3339  */
3340 
3341  // ignore lower bits if necessary
3342  int bytes = datawidth / 8;
3343  int ignore = (bytes == 0) ? 0 : (int)log2(bytes);
3344 
3345  // ALTSYNRAM1_address_a =
3346  // memory_controller_address_a[5-1+2:2]&{5{select_ALTSYNRAM1}};
3347  Out << indent0 << name << "_address" << postfix
3348  << " = memory_controller_address" << postfix << " ["
3349  << addresswidth << "-1+" << ignore << ":" << ignore << "]"
3350  << " & "
3351  << "{" << addresswidth << "{select_" << name << postfix << "}}"
3352  << ";\n";
3353 
3354  // ALTSYNRAM1_write_enable_a = memory_controller_write_enable_a &
3355  // select_ALTSYNRAM1;
3356  Out << indent0 << name << "_write_enable" << postfix
3357  << " = memory_controller_write_enable" << postfix
3358  << " & select_" << name << postfix << ";\n";
3359 
3360  // ALTSYNRAM1_in_a[32-1:0] = memory_controller_in_a[32-1:0] ;
3361  Out << indent0 << name << "_in" << postfix << " [" << datawidth
3362  << "-1:0] = memory_controller_in" << postfix << "[" << datawidth
3363  << "-1:0];\n";
3364 
3365  Out << "\n";
3366 
3367  } else {
3368 
3369  // all structs are 64 bits wide
3370  assert(datawidth == 64);
3371 
3372  Out << indent0 << name << "_address" << postfix
3373  << " = memory_controller_address" << postfix << "["
3374  << addresswidth + 3 << "-1:3] & "
3375  << "{" << addresswidth << "{select_" << name << postfix << "}}"
3376  << ";\n";
3377 
3378  Out << indent0 << name << "_write_enable" << postfix
3379  << " = memory_controller_write_enable" << postfix
3380  << " & select_" << name << postfix << ";\n";
3381 
3382  Out << indent << "\t\t" << name << "_in" << postfix << " = 0;\n";
3383 
3384  Out << indent << "case(memory_controller_size" << postfix << ")\n";
3385 
3386  Out << indent << "\t3:\n";
3387  Out << indent << "\tbegin\n";
3388  Out << indent << "\t\t" << name << "_in" << postfix
3389  << "[64-1:0] = memory_controller_in" << postfix
3390  << "[64-1:0];\n";
3391  Out << indent << "\t\t" << name << "_byteena" << postfix
3392  << " = 8'b11111111;\n";
3393  Out << indent << "\tend\n";
3394 
3395  Out << indent << "\t2:\n";
3396  Out << indent << "\tbegin\n";
3397  Out << indent << "\t\tif (memory_controller_address" << postfix
3398  << " [2:2] == 0)\n";
3399  Out << indent << "\t\tbegin\n";
3400  Out << indent << "\t\t\t" << name << "_in" << postfix
3401  << "[32-1:0] = memory_controller_in" << postfix
3402  << "[32-1:0];\n";
3403  Out << indent << "\t\t\t" << name << "_byteena" << postfix
3404  << " = 8'b00001111;\n";
3405  Out << indent << "\t\tend\n";
3406  Out << indent << "\t\telse\n";
3407  Out << indent << "\t\tbegin\n";
3408  Out << indent << "\t\t\t" << name << "_in" << postfix
3409  << "[64-1:32] = memory_controller_in" << postfix
3410  << "[32-1:0];\n";
3411  Out << indent << "\t\t\t" << name << "_byteena" << postfix
3412  << " = 8'b11110000;\n";
3413  Out << indent << "\t\tend\n";
3414  Out << indent << "\tend\n";
3415 
3416  Out << indent << "\t1:\n";
3417  Out << indent << "\tbegin\n";
3418  Out << indent << "\t\tcase (memory_controller_address" << postfix
3419  << "[2:1])\n";
3420  for (int c = 0; c < 4; c++) {
3421  Out << indent << "\t\t\t" << c << ":\n";
3422  Out << indent << "\t\t\tbegin\n";
3423  Out << indent << "\t\t\t\t" << name << "_in" << postfix << "["
3424  << ((c * 16) + 16) << "-1:" << (c * 16) << "] "
3425  << "= memory_controller_in" << postfix << "[16-1:0];\n";
3426  Out << indent << "\t\t\t\t" << name << "_byteena" << postfix
3427  << " "
3428  << "= 8'd" << (3 << (c * 2)) << ";\n";
3429  Out << indent << "\t\t\tend\n";
3430  }
3431  Out << indent << "\t\tendcase\n";
3432  Out << indent << "\tend\n";
3433 
3434  Out << indent << "\t0:\n";
3435  Out << indent << "\t\tcase (memory_controller_address" << postfix
3436  << "[2:0])\n";
3437  for (int i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
3438  Out << indent << "\t\t\t" << i << ":\n";
3439  Out << indent << "\t\t\tbegin\n";
3440  Out << indent << "\t\t\t\t" << name << "_in" << postfix << "["
3441  << 8 * (i + 1) << "-1:" << 8 * i << "] = "
3442  << "memory_controller_in" << postfix << "[8-1:0];\n";
3443  Out << indent << "\t\t\t\t" << name << "_byteena" << postfix
3444  << " = "
3445  << "8'd" << (1 << i) << ";\n";
3446  Out << indent << "\t\t\tend\n";
3447  }
3448  Out << indent << "\tendcase\n";
3449 
3450  Out << indent << "endcase\n";
3451 
3452  Out << "\n";
3453  }
3454  // debugging
3455  // Out << "always @(posedge clk)" << "\n";
3456  // Out << indent0 <<
3457  // "$display(\"addr:%x\",memory_controller_address);\n";
3458  /*

3460  ": %d we: %d in: %d out: %d\"," <<
3461  name << "_address," <<
3462  name << "_write_enable," <<
3463  name << "_in," <<
3464  name << "_out);\n";
3465  */
3466  }

5877  bool voidtype = true;
5878  if (ret->getTypeID() != Type::VoidTyID) {
5879  voidtype = false;
5880  }
5881

5885  << "begin\n"

6992  {
6993  if (signal->getNumDrivers() == 0)
6994  return;
6995 
6996  bool reg = signal->isReg();
6997  unsigned sigWidth = signal->getWidth().numBits(rtl, alloc);
6998

7000  std::string assignOp = "<=";
7001  if (signal == rtl->getUnsynthesizableSignal()) {
7002  Out << "/* Unsynthesizable Statements */\n";
7003  Out << "always @(posedge clk)\n";
7004  Out << "\tif (!memory_controller_waitrequest) begin\n";
7005  } else {
7006  if (reg) {
7007  Out << "always @(posedge clk) begin\n";
7008  const RTLSignal *defaultDriver = signal->getDefaultDriver();
7009  if (defaultDriver) {
7010  // ie. memory_controller_enable as a default of 0
7011  Out << "\t" << signal->getName() << " " << assignOp << " ";
7012  printValue(defaultDriver, sigWidth);
7013  Out << ";\n";
7014  }
7015  } else {
7016  Out << "always @(*) begin\n";
7017  // use blocking assignment for combinational logic
7018  assignOp = "=";
7019  const RTLSignal *defaultDriver = signal->getDefaultDriver();
7020  if (defaultDriver) {
7021  // ie. memory_controller_enable as a default of 0
7022  Out << "\t" << signal->getName() << " " << assignOp << " ";
7023  printValue(defaultDriver, sigWidth);
7024  Out << ";\n";
7025  }
7026  }
7027  }
7028

7031

7037  printValue(driver, sigWidth);
7038  Out << ";\n";

7040  } else {

7042  }

5014  {
5015 
5016  const Type *ret = F->getReturnType();
5017  bool return64 = false;
5018  Out << "wire finish;\n";
5019  if (!(ret->isVoidTy())) {
5020  if (ret->isPointerTy()) {
5021  Out << "wire [31:0] return_val_wire;\n";
5022  Out << "reg [31:0] return_val;\n";
5023  } else {
5024  unsigned bitwidth = getBitWidth(ret);
5025  if (bitwidth == 64) {
5026  Out << "wire read_data_asserted_hi;\n";
5027  return64 = true;
5028  }
5029 
5030  Out << "wire [" << bitwidth - 1 << ":0] return_val_wire;\n";
5031  Out << "reg [" << bitwidth - 1 << ":0] return_val;\n";
5032  }

5541  << "\tstart_reg <= start;\n"

5546  << "\tfinish_reg_dly <= finish_reg;\n"

5550  "begin\n"<<

5554  "\telse if (!av_waitrequest)\n"<<

5556  "\tfinish_reg_dly <= finish_reg;\n"<<

5565  << "\t\tdone <= 1'b1;\n"

5577  */

4183  instanceName = syncType + "_inst" + utostr(i);
4184  // wire select_lock;

4188  << "select_" << instanceName << " = (tag_" << syncType
4189  << " == ";

4192  } else if (syncType == "barrier") {
4193  // for barriers, the tag starts at 1
4194  Out << utostr(i + 1) << ")";
4195  }

4197  // synchronization core

7479

7483  port_end = ports->end();

7487  << port->getSignal()->getName() << "_r)";
7488  }
7489  } else {
7490  Out << ",\n\t." << DEBUG_SIGNAL_NAME_CURRENT_STATE << "("
7491  << DEBUG_SIGNAL_NAME_CURRENT_STATE << ")";
7492  }
7493
