7185  {
7186 
7187  // unsigned w2 = sig->getNativeWidth().numBits(rtl,alloc);
7188  // if(w2>=2) {
7189  // w=w2;
7190  // w = min(w,w2);
7191  /* if(w>w2 && sig->getSigned()) {
7192  errs() << "w: "<<utostr(w)<<" w2: "<<utostr(w2)
7193  << " for signal:
7194  "<<sig->getName()<<sig->getValue()<<"\n";
7195  }*/
7196  // }
7197 
7198  bool USE_LSB = LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("MB_MINIMIZE_LSB");
7199  std::string hi = sig->getWidth().getHi();
7200  std::string lo = sig->getWidth().getLo();
7201  unsigned extendFrom = 0, LSB = 0;
7202  if (USE_LSB) {
7203  if (hi != "")
7204  stringstream(hi) >> extendFrom;
7205  stringstream(lo) >> LSB;
7206  } else
7207  extendFrom = sig->getWidth().numBits(rtl, alloc) - 1;
7208  bool isSigned = sig->getWidth().getSigned();
7209  // normal variable ie. cur_state
7210  unsigned minW = extendFrom + 1;
7211  if (w > 0 && (LSB > 0 || (minW < w))) {
7212  // if minW is 1, signal needs to printed something like this:
7213  // "{32{sig_name}}" if the
7214  // signal is signed
7215  if (minW == 1) {
7216  if (isSigned)
7217  Out << "{" << utostr(w) << "{" << sig->getName() << "}}";
7218  else if (zeroExtend)
7219  Out << "{" << utostr(w - 1) << "'d0," << sig->getName() << "}";
7220  else
7221  Out << sig->getName();
7222  } else {
7223  // Opening bracket needed in all cases
7224  Out << "{";
7225  // The first part of a signal with extendFrom==19 should be printed
7226  // like this:
7227  //"{12{sig_name[19]}},", if the signal is signed
7228  if (minW < w) {
7229  if (isSigned)
7230  Out << "{" << utostr(w - minW) << "{" << sig->getName()
7231  << "[" << utostr(extendFrom) << "]"
7232  << "}},";
7233  else if (zeroExtend)
7234  Out << utostr(w - minW) << "'d0,";
7235  }
7236  // The second part of the same signal can be like this if LSB==0:
7237  // sig_name
7238  if (LSB == 0)
7239  Out << sig->getName();
7240  // if LSB>0, the second part of the signal should be like this:
7241  // sig_name[19:LSB]
7242  // if LSB>0, the third part of the signal should be zeroes
7243  else {
7244  Out << sig->getName() << "[" << utostr(extendFrom) << ":"
7245  << utostr(LSB) << "]," << utostr(LSB) << "'d0";
7246  }
7247  Out << "}";
7248  }
7249  }
7250 
7251  else {
7252  Out << sig->getName();
7253  }
7254 }

1838  {
1839  std::vector<std::string> paths = split(ssPaths, ' ');
1840 
1841  for (std::vector<std::string>::iterator it = paths.begin();
1842  it != paths.end(); ++it) {
1843 
1844  ifstream verilogFile;
1845  string line;
1846  string verilogFileName{it->c_str()};
1847 
1848  verilogFile.open(it->c_str());
1849 
1850  assert(verilogFile.is_open() &&
1851  "One of the paths to a static verilog file did not load "
1852  "properly. Static Verilog Paths cannot have spaces in them. "
1853  "Check the paths in the BOARD_TOPS and BOARD_UTILITIES "
1854  "environment variables to make sure none of them have spaces.");
1855 
1856  Out << "// Adding code from verilog file: ";
1857  Out << it->c_str() << '\n';
1858 
1859  Out << '\n';
1860  while (getline(verilogFile, line)) {
1861  bool foundToken = false;
1862 
1863  if (line.find("<") != std::string::npos) {
1864  foundToken = true;
1865  if (line.find("<LEGUP_PORT_LIST>") != std::string::npos) {
1866  printBoardPortList();
1867  } else if (line.find("<LEGUP_SIGNAL_DEC>") !=
1868  std::string::npos) {
1869  printBoardSignalDeclarations();
1870  } else if (line.find("<LEGUP_LOGIC>") != std::string::npos) {
1871  printBoardLogic();
1872  } else if (line.find("<LEGUP_TOP_SIGNALS>") !=
1873  std::string::npos) {
1874  printBoardTopSignals();
1875  } else {
1876  foundToken = false;
1877  }
1878  if (foundToken) {
1879  Out << '\n';
1880  }
1881  }
1882  if (!foundToken) {
1883  Out << '\n' << line;
1884  }
1885  }
1886  verilogFile.close();
1887  Out << '\n';
1888  }
1889 }

void legup::VerilogWriter::printVerilogOperator ( const RTLOp *  op,
unsigned  w = 0 
)
private

Definition at line 7366 of file VerilogWriter.cpp.

7366  {
7367  assert(op);
7368 
7369  if (op->getOpcode() == RTLOp::Finish) {
7370  Out << "$finish";
7371  } else if (op->getOpcode() == RTLOp::Write ||
7372  op->getOpcode() == RTLOp::Display) {
7373  printDisplay(op);
7374  } else {
7375  switch (op->getNumOperands()) {
7376  case 3:
7377  assert(op->getOpcode() == RTLOp::Sel);
7378  Out << "(";
7379  printValue(op->getOperand(0), w);
7380  Out << " ? ";
7381  printValue(op->getOperand(1), w);
7382  Out << " : ";
7383  printValue(op->getOperand(2), w);
7384  Out << ")";
7385  break;
7386  case 2:
7387  if (op->getOpcode() == RTLOp::Concat) {
7388  Out << "{";
7389  unsigned op0_width =
7390  op->getOperand(0)->getWidth().numNativeBits(rtl, alloc);
7391  printValue(op->getOperand(0), op0_width, true);
7392  Out << ",";
7393  unsigned op1_width =
7394  op->getOperand(1)->getWidth().numNativeBits(rtl, alloc);
7395  printValue(op->getOperand(1), op1_width, true);
7396  Out << "}";
7397  } else {
7398  Out << "(";
7399  printValue(op->getOperand(0), w);
7400  printVerilogOpcode(op->getOpcode());
7401  printValue(op->getOperand(1), w);
7402  Out << ")";
7403  }
7404  break;
7405  case 1:
7406  if (op->getOpcode() == RTLOp::Not) {
7407  Out << "~(";
7408  printValue(op->getOperand(0), w);
7409  Out << ")";
7410  } else if (op->getOpcode() == RTLOp::SExt) {
7411  Out << "$signed(";
7412  const RTLSignal *op0 = op->getOperand(0);
7413  // The left most bit of the signal will count as a sign bit.
7414  // If this is an unsigned signal, we need to pad it with a zero
7415  // Typically, when setting the zeroExtend flag to true, this
7416  // will happen
7417  // but with a signed comparison, since the output width is one,
7418  // printValue
7419  // won't know by how much to zeroExtend, so we have to set w
7420  // manually to be
7421  // one more than signal width
7422  bool op0IsSigned = op0->getWidth().getSigned();
7423  unsigned nativeBits = op0->getWidth().numNativeBits(rtl, alloc);
7424  unsigned bits = op0->getWidth().numBits(rtl, alloc);
7425  if (op0->getWidth().isNewStyleRTLWidth()) {
7426  nativeBits = op0->getWidth().numNativeBits(rtl, alloc);
7427  }
7428  if (op0IsSigned && nativeBits > bits) {
7429  printValue(op->getOperand(0), nativeBits, true);
7430  } else
7431  printValue(op->getOperand(0), w);
7432  Out << ")";
7433  } else if (op->getOpcode() == RTLOp::ZExt) {
7434  printValue(op->getOperand(0), w);
7435  } else {
7436  assert(op->getOpcode() == RTLOp::Trunc);
7437  // ie. memory_controller_out[31:0]
7438  printValue(op->getOperand(0), w);
7439  // don't truncate a constant
7440  if (!op->getOperand(0)->isConst()) {
7441  Out << op->getWidth().str();
7442  }
7443  }
7444  break;
7445  default:
7446  llvm_unreachable("Invalid RTLOp!");
7447  }
7448  }
7449 }

2645 
2646  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("MULTIPUMPING")) {
2647  clk_name = "clk_orig";
2648  clk = m->addWire("clk");
2649  } else {
2650 
2651  clk_name = "clk";
2652  clk = m->addReg("clk");
2653  }
2654  RTLSignal *reset = m->addReg("reset");

2656  RTLSignal *wait = m->addReg("waitrequest");

2667  pc_module = m->addWire(
2668  "pc_module", RTLWidth(alloc->getDbgInfo()->getInstanceIdBits()));
2669  pc_state = m->addWire("pc_state",
2670  RTLWidth(alloc->getDbgInfo()->getStateBits()));

2672  uart_rx = m->addWire("uart_rx");
2673  debugger_state = m->addWire("debugger_state", RTLWidth(8));
2674  }

2677  t->addIn("clk")->connect(clk);
2678 
2679  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("MULTIPUMPING")) {

2682  RTLSignal *clk1x_follower = m->addWire("clk1x_follower");
2683 
2684  t->addIn("clk2x")->connect(clk2x);
2685  t->addIn("clk1x_follower")->connect(clk1x_follower);
2686 
2687  // create pll
2688  /*pll pll_inst (
2689  .inclk0 ( clk_orig ), // 50 MHz
2690  .c0 ( clk ), // 50 MHz
2691  .c1 ( clk2x ) // 100 MHz
2692  );
2693  */
2694  RTLModule *pll = m->addModule("pll", "pll_inst");
2695  pll->addIn("inclk0")->connect(clk_orig);
2696  // must have 1x clock coming from the same PLL as the 2x clock to avoid
2697  // large clock skew that can cause hold-time violations
2698  pll->addOut("c0")->connect(clk);
2699  pll->addOut("c1")->connect(clk2x);
2700 
2701  // create clock follower
2702  /*
2703  clock_follower clock_follower_inst (
2704  .reset ( reset ),
2705  .clk1x ( clk ),
2706  .clk2x ( clk2x ),
2707  .clk1x_follower ( clk1x_follower )
2708  );
2709  */
2710  RTLModule *clock_follower =
2711  m->addModule("clock_follower", "clock_follower_inst");
2712  clock_follower->addIn("reset")->connect(reset);
2713  clock_follower->addIn("clk1x")->connect(clk);
2714  clock_follower->addIn("clk2x")->connect(clk2x);
2715  clock_follower->addOut("clk1x_follower")->connect(clk1x_follower);
2716  }
2717

2719  t->addIn("start")->connect(start);
2720  t->addIn("waitrequest")->connect(wait);
2721  t->addOut("finish")->connect(finish);
2722  t->addOut("return_val")->connect(return_val);
2723

2725  t->addOut(DEBUG_SIGNAL_NAME_ACTIVE_INST)->connect(pc_module);
2726  t->addOut(DEBUG_SIGNAL_NAME_CURRENT_STATE)->connect(pc_state);
2727  t->addOut("uart_rx")->connect(uart_rx);
2728  t->addOut("uart_tx")->connect(uart_tx);
2729  t->addOut("hlsd_state")->connect(debugger_state);
2730  }
2731 
2732  std::string old_body = m->getBody();
2733  raw_string_ostream body(old_body);
2734 
2735  body << "\n"
2736  << "initial \n"
2737  << " " << clk_name << " = 0;\n"
2738  << "always @(" << clk_name << ")\n"
2739  << " " << clk_name << " <= #10 ~" << clk_name << ";\n"
2740  << "\n"
2741  << "initial begin\n"
2742  << "//$monitor(\"At t=%t clk=%b %b %b %b %d\", $time, clk, reset, "
2743  << "start, finish, return_val);\n"
2744  << "@(negedge clk);\n"
2745  << "reset <= 1;\n"
2746  << "@(negedge clk);\n"
2747  << "reset <= 0;\n"
2748  << "start <= 1;\n"
2749  << "@(negedge clk);\n"
2750  << "start <= 0;\n"
2751  << "end\n"
2752  << "\n"
2753  << "always@(finish) begin\n"
2754  << " if (finish == 1) begin\n"
2755  << " $display(\"At t=%t clk=%b finish=%b return_val=%d\", "
2756  << "$time, clk, finish, return_val);\n"
2757  << " $display(\"Cycles: %d\", ($time-50)/20);\n"
2758  << " $finish;\n"
2759  << " end\n"
2760  << "end\n\n";
2761 
2762  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("TEST_WAITREQUEST")) {
2763  // keep the wait request high for 5 cycles, then low for 1 cycle and
2764  // repeat
2765  body << "integer counter;\n"
2766  << "initial begin\n"
2767  << "counter <= 0;\n"
2768  << "waitrequest <= 1;\n"
2769  << "@(negedge clk);\n"
2770  << "@(negedge clk);\n"
2771  << "waitrequest <= 0;\n"
2772  << "end\n"
2773  << "always @(posedge clk) begin\n"
2774  << "\tif (counter < 5) begin\n"
2775  << "\twaitrequest <= 1;\n"
2776  << "\tcounter <= counter + 1;\n"
2777  << "\tend\n"
2778  << "\telse\n"
2779  << "\tbegin\n"
2780  << "\twaitrequest <= 0;\n"
2781  << "\tcounter <= 0;\n"
2782  << "\tend\n"
2783  << "end\n\n";
2784  } else {
2785  body << "initial begin\n"
2786  << "waitrequest <= 1;\n"
2787  << "@(negedge clk);\n"
2788  << "@(negedge clk);\n"
2789  << "waitrequest <= 0;\n"
2790  << "end\n\n";
2791  }
2792 
2793  m->setBody(body.str());
2794  printRTL(m);
2795  delete m;
2796 }

bool legup::VerilogWriter::stripRAM ( RAM *  R)
private

Definition at line 2800 of file VerilogWriter.cpp.

2800  {
2801  const Value *V = R->getValue();
2802  // if pure h/w then don't strip anything
2803  // if (LEGUP_CONFIG->numAccelerators() == 0) return false;
2804  if (!LEGUP_CONFIG->isHybridFlow())
2805  return false;
2806 
2807  if (const GlobalVariable *G = dyn_cast<GlobalVariable>(V)) {
2808  // don't strip constant values
2809  // or when it's the PCIE flow
2810  // or if hybrid flow is used and if it can't be found in the MIPS
2811  // disassembly
2812  // it can't be found it can MIPS disassembly if it's a global variable
2813  // that is only used by HW accelerators
2814  // in this case the linker will optimize away the global variables from
2815  // the SW side
2816  // if (!G->isConstant() && !LEGUP_CONFIG->isPCIeFlow() &&
2817  // searchMIPSAddress(R) != "") {
2818  // if (!G->isConstant() && !LEGUP_CONFIG->isPCIeFlow() &&
2819  // globalAddresses.find(R->getName()) == globalAddresses.end()) {
2820  if (!G->isConstant() && !LEGUP_CONFIG->isPCIeFlow()) {
2821  return true;
2822  }
2823  }
2824  return false;
2825 }
